hits.job_description:
With increasing global interest in renewable energy technology given the backdrop of climate change, storage of electrical energy has become particularly relevant. Most sustainable technologies (e.g., wind and solar) produce electricity intermittently. Thus, converting electrical energy and base molecules (i.e., H2O, N2) into chemical feedstock (e.g. H2, NH3, NOx) is of paramount importance. While H2O splitting is compatible with renewable electricity, N2 fixation is currently dominated by thermally activated processes. This postdoctoral position will focus on the development and evaluation of plasma for nitrogen fixation in a close collaboration with industry.

The research tasks are highly interdisciplinary and will perfectly align with emerging research lines and granted projects at DIFFER.

  • Development and characterization of materials for solid oxide electrolysis cells: electrodes and ionic conducting membranes.
  • Physical-, chemical- and structural characterization (XRD, XPS, SEM).
  • Gas phase analysis of reaction products (GC, MS, FTIR).

hits.title: Wetenschappelijk onderzoeker
hits.job_description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een gedreven en enthousiaste wetenschappelijk onderzoeker voor 32-36 uur per week met expertise in analyseren van longitudinale datasets en interesse in praktijkrelevant en/of epidemiologisch onderzoek.

Wat houdt de functie in?
Voor ongeveer de helft van je aanstelling doe je werkzaamheden voor DREAMS (www.dreams-study.nl). DREAMS is een landelijk samenwerkingsverband tussen de vier grote, academische instellingen voor kinder- en jeugdpsychiatrie. Dit zijn Accare, LUMC Curium (Leiden), Karakter (Nijmegen) en Levvel (Amsterdam). Het doel van DREAMS is om de kinder- en jeugdpsychiatrische zorg en beloop van psychopathologie in Nederland beter in kaart te brengen en zo de zorg te verbeteren, bijvoorbeeld door voorspellers van behandelsucces te onderzoeken. Ook wordt er gekeken naar de impact van actuele maatschappelijke thema’s, zoals de huidige Covid-19 crisis, op de kinderen en jeugdigen die bij de deelnemende instellingen in zorg zijn. Het DREAMS samenwerkingsverband is een nieuw wetenschappelijk consortium en biedt veel mogelijkheden om eigen interesses in de mentale zorg voor kinderen en jongeren om te zetten in concrete onderzoeksprojecten.

De andere helft van je aanstelling werk je met bestaande datasets met een focus op het schrijven van wetenschappelijke artikelen. Zo zijn er data beschikbaar van een onderzoek binnen Accare dat zich richt op de relatie tussen contextuele variabelen en succes van behandeling. Bovendien zijn er klinische en genetische gegevens beschikbaar van grote longitudinale cohorten zoals ALSPAC, EMTICS en TIC Genetics. De laatste twee hebben betrekking op kinderen met ticstoornissen. Een speerpunt van het onderzoek bij Accare is daarnaast het verminderen van onnodig medicatiegebruik bij kinderen en jongeren met ADHD of gedragsproblemen. Je helpt ons dit onderzoek verder vorm te geven en een brug te slaan met de klinische praktijk. Het betreft een veelzijdige en uitdagende functie met als doel het onderzoeksteam van het Child Study Center blijvend te versterken en het longitudinale onderzoek verder uit te bouwen.    

Je voornaamste taken en verantwoordelijkheden zijn:

hits.job_description:

WAT GA JE DOEN?

  • Het zelfstandig leiden van diverse projecten, met name binnen de wettelijke overheidstaken (WOT) in het thema Natuur&Milieu en beleidsondersteunende taken binnen de missie Kringlooplandbouw. Voorbeelden van projecten vind je HIER;

Algemeen

Functie-omschrijving en takenpakket
De beleidsmedewerker onderzoek en kwaliteitszorg heeft een centrale rol bij de voorbereiding, ontwikkeling, implementatie en evaluatie van onderzoekbeleid (o.a. kwaliteitszorg, promotiebeleid, subsidieverwerving i.s.m. de afdeling Grant Support). Je fungeert, o.a. binnen deze thema’s, als sparringpartner van het afdelingshoofd RST, de vice-decaan onderzoek en de onderzoeksprogrammaleiders van de faculteit.

hits.title: Teamleider Student Administratie (0,8 - 1,0 fte)

Positionering van de functie
Het team Student Administratie inschrijf en volg bestaat uit 9 medewerkers, die samen verantwoordelijk zijn voor het in- en uitschrijven van studenten (inschrijf) en faciliteren van de studievoortgang (volg). Dit team vormt een onderdeel van de afdeling Student Administratie (SA), wat weer onderdeel van de divisie Academic Services (AS) en bestaat uit 58 medewerkers. Student Administration is verantwoordelijk voor de volgende zaken: 

  • het in- en uitschrijven van studenten;
  • de centrale registratie van de studieresultaten;
  • de diplomering van studenten;
  • het roosteren van de colleges en (her)tentamens;
  • de afname van de tentamens;
  • de eerstelijns vragen van studenten via de Student Desk.

 

Voor het team Student administratie “inschrijf en volg”, is per direct een vacature van één jaar (met uitzicht op verlenging) voor een Teamleider Student Administratie (0,8 – 1,0 fte). Wij zijn op zoek naar een young professional, die de mensen in het team begeleid in hun doorontwikkeling.

 

Het team bestaat uit een groep medewerkers, die sinds lange periode met elkaar samen werken en zelfstandig functioneren. Vanwege de Coronaperiode hebben de medewerkers de afgelopen jaren de aandacht gelegd op het uitvoeren van het reguliere werk. Hierdoor is minder tijd geweest voor verbeter- en verandertrajecten. De teamleider zal met name gevraagd worden om samen met het team de processen en werkinstructies te optimaliseren en veranderingen in o.a. implementeren van wijzigingen in applicaties, beleid en wetgeving in de dagelijkse werkzaamheden te realiseren. 

 

In de aard van de werkzaamheden van het team moet o.a. gedacht worden aan het in- en uitschrijfproces, inclusief collegegeld heffingen zo optimaal mogelijk te laten verlopen, het opvoeren van studieresultaten en vrijstellingen in Osiris, het ervoor zorgen dat de student een compleet overzicht heeft van zijn studievoortgang, het controleren van de studievoortgang van de bachelor en masterstudenten en als aan alle onderdelen van de opleiding is voldaan en het vervaardigen van diplomastukken.

 

Verantwoordelijkheden en taken teamleider 

  • Samen opstellen van een toekomstplan voor het team administratie en bijdragen aan de realisatie ervan
  • Uitvoeren van het HR beleid in het eigen team
  • Leiding en sturing geven aan medewerkers en werkzaamheden binnen het team i.s.m de coördinator van de medewerkers “volg” en de medewerkers “inschrijf”
  • Structureel overleg met afdelingshoofd Student Administration en de andere teamleiders van Student Administration;
  • Structureel overleg met teams zoals Informatie Management (functioneel beheer en consultants Osiris) en Finance Services en Controle over o.a. de openstaande issues en planning komende periode. 
  • Afhandelen van klachten van studenten en hierin adviseren van het afdelingshoofd;
  • Bijdrage leveren aan verbeter- en verandertrajecten in relatie tot inschrijving en volg (bijv. wijzigingen in toepassen van Osiris, verbetering van processen);
  • Bijdragen aan beleidsontwikkeling in relatie tot nieuwe wetgeving en meewerken aan de implementatie ervan

 

Er zijn diverse periodes in relatie tot inschrijving en diplomering per jaar en je bent bereid om je vakantie hierop aan te passen.

hits.title: Promovendus "kwaliteit van routine zorgdata" 1,0 fte voor 4 jaar
hits.job_description:
Functie 
Binnen de academische werkplaats ‘kwaliteit van huisartsen en ziekenhuiszorg’ zoeken wij een promovendus voor het project ‘kwaliteit van routine zorgdata’. Het project wordt uitgevoerd vanuit Tranzo, onderdeel van de Tilburg School of Social and Behavioral Sciences van Tilburg University. 

 

Achtergrond
Ons zorgstelsel brengt een groeiende hoeveelheid gegevens voort. Declaraties, elektronische patiëntendossiers, gezondheids-apps. Die gegevens worden gebruikt in het zorgproces zelf, maar steeds vaker ook voor onderzoek en statistiek. Maar zijn die gegevens daar eigenlijk wel voor geschikt? En hoe kom je daar achter? Welke factoren bevorderen of belemmeren de kwaliteit van gegevens? En hoe kun je de kwaliteit van gegevens verbeteren? Dit zijn vragen waarmee je je gaat bezig houden als promovendus. 

 

Wat ga je doen? 
De invulling van je promotietraject ligt nog niet vast. De eerste taak is dan ook het uitwerken van de ideeën die daarover bestaan bij jou en je begeleiders. Je werk bestaat uit desk-research, literatuuronderzoek, analyse van grote gegevensbestanden, praten met zorgverleners, patiënten en beleidsmakers. Zo kun je bijvoorbeeld gebruik maken van declaratiebestanden en gegevens uit elektronische patiëntendossiers van zorgverleners. Je werkt samen met onderzoekers bij het Nivel en bij het Zorginstituut en je onderhoudt betrekkingen met andere relevante partijen. Een deel van het werk zal betrekking hebben op gegevens die verzameld worden in Nivel Zorgregistraties eerste lijn en gegevens uit zorgdeclaraties.

hits.title: Junior Research Grant Advisor (0,8-1,0 fte)
hits.job_description:
A Grant Advisor works with researchers to help them identify funding opportunities that match their ambition and then supports the process of preparing a winning proposal.

We are looking for persons who want to develop themselves into a top tier grant advisors. Prior experience with grants is not needed, rather the right drive, skills and personality. If you have excellent English communication skills (both written and verbal), the ability to contextualize complex concepts and the drive and the confidence to manage a collaborative process for multiple international stakeholders you are our ideal candidate.

Surrounded by a team of Grant Advisors you will receive training in the intricacies of the various funding schemes, how to effectively apply a coaching communication style and the highly sought-after skillset of coordinating collaborative grant writing processes.

You will join the Grants Support team at Erasmus Research Services (ERS) working on major research initiatives and spend 50% of your working hours seconded to the Erasmus School of History, Culture and Communication (ESHCC) Research Office as their dedicated grant advisor.

Together we foster a culture amongst researchers that stimulates funding ambitions, build and maintain a network with relevant institutes (s.a. media and creative industry, museums)  and act as an expert advisor and source of information for internal and external stakeholders. 

Main responsibilities:

  • Be the right hand to lead researchers preparing major collaborative research proposals;
  • Scout for project ideas within the faculty of ESHCC;
  • Identify and create opportunities for personal and collaborative research grants at NWO and other national research funders as well as at European level (Horizon Europe);
  • Support researchers as they apply for research grants, and coach them throughout the application process;
  • Act as first point of contact for ESHCC researchers that want to apply for a grant and organize internal alignment with relevant processes such as financial and project control;
  • Organize, in collaboration with your colleagues at the ERS grant support office, information sessions, trainings and workshops about research grant opportunities in the field of Humanities and Social Sciences;
  • Proactively engage with external contacts like partner institutes, societal stakeholders and relevant agencies to anticipate new developments and to help in building consortia.
hits.requirements_description:
Requirements

Required experience, skills and competencies:

  • The ambition and willingness to work hard towards positive societal impact;
  • An academic level of thinking and working. A doctorate in humanities or social sciences will be viewed positively but is not a requirement;
  • The capacity to collaborate with a broad range of internal and external stakeholders;
  • An entrepreneurial, hands-on and open attitude; excellent organization skills;
  • Proactive, stress-resistant, ability to deliver under peak performance;
  • Excellent verbal and written command of English (CEFR level C1). Dutch language skills will be viewed positively;

You will become a member of the department Erasmus Research Services, a new and rapidly growing department of currently 35 people. Every person in your team is seconded for 50% of their time to one of the faculties and you will become the dedicated advisor for the Erasmus School of History, Culture and Communication (ESHCC). You will report to the Heads of Grants of the Erasmus Research Services and the senior research policy officer of ESHCC.
hits.conditions_description:
Conditions of employment

Fixed-term contract: Initially for one year. If your performance is satisfactory the contract may be converted to permanent after the first year.

An internationally-oriented and varied work within an enthusiastic team, with attractive fringe benefits in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities (CAO-NU). We offer a contract initially for one year (1 fte, full-time appointment is 38 hours) which may become permanent if your performance is satisfactory. As Junior Grant Advisor your remuneration will grow with how quickly you learn and develop. Your start up salary will be in line with salary scale 10 from CAO NU and thus range between € 2.846,- and € 4.490,- gross per month. At the start of your contract you will agree on a number of development goals with your managers which when met will lead to a guaranteed promotion to Scale 11 from CAO NU (€ 3.821.- to € 5230.-).

Erasmus University Rotterdam offers attractive terms of employment, including a holiday allowance of 8%, a year-end payment of 8.3% and 41 holidays per year based on a full-time appointment. In addition, EUR takes part in the ABP pension scheme, and we also offer partially paid parental leave. Moreover, EUR staff members are allowed to make use of the EUR facilities, including the Erasmus Sports Centre and the University Library.

Diversity & Inclusion 

Erasmus University Rotterdam aspires to be an equitable and inclusive community. We nurture an open culture, where everyone is supported to fulfill their full potential. We see inclusivity of talent as the basis of our successes, and the diversity of perspectives and people as a highly valued outcome. EUR provides equal opportunities to all employees and applicants regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, functional impairment, citizenship, or any other aspect which makes them unique. We look forward to welcoming you to our community.
hits.employer_description:
Employer

Erasmus University Rotterdam

The Erasmus University Rotterdam (EUR), named after Rotterdam-born humanist and theologian Erasmus, is a research university with a strong international orientation and a pronounced social focus, both in its education and research activities. On the lively, modern campus, more than 28.000 students and scholars of more than 100 nationalities are constantly encouraged to develop their talents and meet their ambition. Our more than 2700 scientists and employees work together with all our students to solve challenges faced by global society, drawing their inspiration from the consistently dynamic and cosmopolitan city of Rotterdam. The academic education offered at our faculties is intensive, engaging and strongly focused on practical application. hits.title: PhD position on mass transport modelling from GRACE/GRACE-FO data
hits.job_description:
The continued observation of the temporal changes of the Earth's gravity field is essential for understanding mass transport, caused by processes in the oceans and atmosphere, by melting ice caps and glaciers, by large-scale ground water use, among others. Mass transport is an essential climate variable, and its monitoring is required for understanding climate change. It is also crucial for monitoring hydrological processes at global and regional scales, thereby providing information for water security relevant for agriculture and drink water supply of billions of people worldwide. Space-borne gravimetry, notably in the form of the Gravity Recovery And Climate Experiment (GRACE), GRACE Follow-On missions, has provided observations covering two decades, but their full information content remains underutilized. Without fully exploiting the spatial and temporal resolution of gravimetric data, the ability to separate the underlying geophysical processes is not possible, crippling our understanding of the effects of climate change. 

This research aims at providing novel mass transport products derived from space-borne gravimetric data coming from past, current, and future missions. This is achieved by innovative methodology, namely by uniquely constraining the data from these missions to geophysical models, thereby combining the strength of the underlying physical knowledge contained in such models and maximising the spatiotemporal resolution of the satellite on-orbit observations. Auxiliary information, such as precipitation records or altimetry data, will establish a suitable temporal evolution, and topography and surface properties will predict a realistic spatial mass distribution. 

The successful candidate will transform the application of gravimetric data in the various geophysical domains by providing mass change estimates with unprecedented spatiotemporal resolution at specific geographical locations and focusing on particular geophysical processes. 

The successful candidate will be responsible for pre-processing the GRACE data, building the mass transport models at selected geographical regions, and validating and improving their parameterisation.

The successful candidate will also be involved in education as MSc student co-supervisor and/or as project coach.

hits.title: Post-doc on data-guided circular strategies for circular ICT in businesses
hits.job_description:
The department of Sustainable Design Engineering (SDE) is looking for a post-doctoral researcher (2 years) to do research on tools for data-driven adoption of circular ICT solutions in businesses.

Design for Sustainability (DfS) is a research group with design for the circular economy as one of its core focal areas. Research aims at the development of methods and tools that enable the design of products that have multiple lifecycles. This research area explores circular design strategies, such as product life-extension, reuse, remanufacturing and recycling, and the technologies and business models that enable these strategies. Knowledge and Intelligence Design (KInD) is a human-centered and multi-disciplinary  research group focusing on the relationship between the science and practice of design, and the digital technology that fuels intelligent products, services, and systems.

We are currently searching for a post-doctoral researcher. The post doc will operate in a national consortium with 10 partners that has the objective to develop a new Critical Resource Planning for ICT tool that will help businesses in their purchase, maintenance, and repair decisions to adopt more circular ICT solutions and to change their behaviors into more sustainable behaviors. The consortium will develop a prototype for this tool: RePlanIT. 

In this project, the post doc will be responsible to develop and validate a prototype of a scalable and dynamic circular product passport and a circular resource planner for ICT hardware, using laptops and data servers as the case. The passport should store information for ICT decision-makers, both about the delivered product (static) and about performance during the use phase (dynamic), which is important for maintenance, reuse, refurbishment, and replacement of the product in relation to the required functionalities of and compatibility within the entire IT system in which the hardware runs. The resource planner aims to make the data from the product passport transparent for ICT service providers (suppliers and/or internal service providers) and refurbishers. This system should enable to report and manage on circular KPIs by (a) predicting the necessity and timing of maintenance (condition-based maintenance), refurbishment and upgrading of the ICT hardware at product level; (b) determine the remaining service life of specific components in case of refurbishment, and (c) develop (phased) circular design and replacement strategies at system level.

The post doc will be part of the Circular Design lab within the faculty. This virtual lab brings together students and researchers with an interest in circular economy. Further, the post doc  will be part of AMS Research Fellow community, specifically the Circularity in Urban Regions program.

We are looking for a candidate with a PhD in design, sustainability/industrial ecology, or computer science/data management, who has a strong interest in studying the intersections between sustainability/circular economy, design tools and circular decision-making. In addition to the research, the post doc will be actively involved in teaching at the Industrial Design Engineering faculty (teaching load of 20%).

hits.title: Postdoctoral fellow, Early-stage quantitative sustainability assessment of emerging technologies (0.8-1.0 fte)
hits.job_description:
The Faculty of Science and Institute of Environmental Sciences  are looking for:

Postdoctoral fellow, Early-stage quantitative sustainability assessment of emerging technologies (0.8-1.0 fte)

Vacancy number: 22-079

Key responsibilities  

We are looking for an outstanding postdoctoral fellow to support an ongoing European project. The project supports the research & innovation around new ideas towards radically new future technologies. The project has been focusing on the development of a new generation of protonic devices, which could radically change the technological landscape. The 21st century has seen an unprecedented proliferation of electronic devices, sharply altering the world economic map and human sociological behaviour. A biomimetic solution is being sought in the project by the development of organic electrochemical transistors and proton transistors using organic/biopolymers and composites. You will be supporting the ongoing early-stage sustainability assessment of this new generation of technologies using life cycle assessment (LCA), working hand-in-hand with top material and technology developers in Europe. The ideal starting date for the position is May 1st 2022.

Key tasks include:

  • Develop new methods to support early-stage quantitative sustainability assessment of emerging technologies;
  • Perform a quantitative sustainability assessment of the new technological setup using life cycle assessment (LCA);
  • Innovate on LCA methods to assess emerging technologies at low TRLs;
  • Support the technology developers in the project with the identification of the most promising design options from a sustainability perspective.

Selection Criteria

  • You should have a PhD in a relevant field, and ideally have proven already to be productive in terms of scientific output. Relevant backgrounds include, but are not limited to, PhDs in industrial ecology, quantitative sustainability science, innovation studies, engineering and modelling.
  • Knowledge of and experience with LCA is a strong advantage.
  • Data management, visualization and programming skills (e.g. in Matlab, Python or R) are an advantage.
  • Experience with the techno-economic assessment of emerging technologies is an advantage.
  • You must be proficient in spoken and written English, have good communication skills. Previous teaching experience will also be valued.
  • Moreover, you are a team player, are able as well to work independently, take initiative, and have a strong interest and motivation to pursue academic research.

hits.job_description:
The Faculty of Science and Institute of Environmental Sciences  are looking for:

Postdoctoral fellow Industrial Ecology | Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) of Electric Mobility (0.8-1.0 fte; 2-3 years)

Vacancy number: 22-078

Key responsibilities

The electrification of road transportation using renewable energy to fuel electric vehicles (EV) is seen as an important contribution to meet climate targets. The postdoctoral researcher will take part in an upcoming EU Project called TranSensus, which aims at developing a European-wide harmonised transport-specific LCA approach. Through collaboration with the automotive, battery and other important industrial stakeholders as well as key research institutes on this topic, state-of-the-art methodological guidance will be developed in this project to provide fair sustainability assessments for electric vehicles and their supply chains. The focus at Leiden University will be on environmental Life Cycle Assessment (LCA), while social and economic aspects will be considered by partners. Within the project, a variety of mobility scenarios will be developed and assessed over their full life cycle to develop and test a harmonized approach to LCA and LCSA. The ideal starting date would be April-May 2022.

  • Proficiency in spoken and written English and good communication skill.

hits.title: Management/Office assistent International Management & Strategy (IM&S) (0,6 fte)
hits.job_description:
De Faculteit Economie en Bedrijfskunde van de Rijksuniversiteit Groningen is op zoek naar een secretaresse voor de vakgroep International Management & Strategy (IM&S). Wij nodigen kandidaten uit te solliciteren naar de functie van: secretaresse bij de vakgroep IM&S (0,6 fte)

De vakgroep Innovatie Management & Strategie is een internationale vakgroep die bestaat uit ongeveer 45 medewerkers. Zij doen onderzoek en verzorgen vakken binnen verschillende bachelor- en masteropleidingen van de Faculteit Economie en Bedrijfskunde. Je gaat deel uitmaken van een professioneel, collegiaal en betrokken team. Samen met drie collega-secretaresses draag je zorg voor de secretariële en administratieve ondersteuning van de vakgroep.

Je pakt een breed scala aan ondersteunende werkzaamheden samen met je collega-secretaresses op. Ook al kent de organisatie een vaste agenda van jaarlijks terugkerende activiteiten en handelingen, toch is elke dag weer anders. Ongestoord een klus afmaken komt zelden voor, je moet snel kunnen schakelen tussen de verschillende soorten werkzaamheden en vragen. Dagelijks komen verschillende typen medewerkers en studenten met allerlei soorten vragen bij jou en je collega’s. En jij voelt precies aan wat de juiste woorden zijn om het doel te bereiken, en wat er van je verwacht wordt. Je hebt gevoel voor de diversiteit binnen de organisatie. Snel schakelen tussen Nederlands en Engels – in woord en geschrift – gaat je probleemloos af. Je hebt oog voor de verschillende stijlen en behoeftes van medewerkers en studenten en met je kennis van systemen en processen weet je hoe je voor een optimale dienstverlening moet zorgen. Soms in antwoord op vragen en verzoeken van de medewerkers die je ondersteunt, maar er wordt ook van je verwacht dat je daar zelf initiatief neemt. Je hebt overzicht over de taken die voorhanden zijn dan wel nog liggen te wachten en je weet welke taken in de nabije toekomst moeten worden opgepakt. Daarnaast is er ruimte om proactief na te denken over ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden binnen de werkzaamheden van het secretariaat.

Werkzaamheden:

• uitvoeren van (administratief) ondersteunende werkzaamheden ten behoeve van (online) onderwijs en onderzoek en het verwerken van informatie via Nestor, ProgRESS WWW en Ocasys
• informatieverstrekking: fungeren als eerste aanspreekpunt voor vragen van medewerkers, studenten en externen en beantwoorden van vragen of doorverwijzen
• organiseren en notuleren (Engelstalig) van vergaderingen
• correspondentie: bewerken en verwerken van zakelijke correspondentie
• telefoon- en e-mailverkeer
• agendabeheer: plannen, agenderen en coördineren van afspraken en attenderen op de nakoming hiervan
• archivering: digitaal documenteren en archiveren van informatie
• faciliteren van nieuwe medewerkers binnen de vakgroep
• ondersteunen bij werving en selectie van nieuw personeel binnen de vakgroep.

hits.title: Medewerker Studentenzaken bij het Education Support Team van Tilburg Law School (0,8-1,0 fte)
hits.job_description:
Het EST geeft ondersteuning aan het onderwijs in brede zin, dus van toelating tot diploma en van individueel studieadvies tot algemene beleidsvorming. Het EST adviseert studenten en docenten, maar ook het Faculteitsbestuur en andere onderwijsgremia. Bovendien monitort het EST de daarvoor noodzakelijke processen. In deze functie van Medewerker Studentenzaken geef je, samen met twee collega’s, voornamelijk ondersteuning aan de Onderwijscoördinatoren/ studieadviseurs en aan de secretarissen van de Examencommissie. 
In de dagelijkse praktijk neemt de examencommissie besluiten over verzoeken van studenten zoals het verlenen van vrijstellingen, toepassen van het bindende studieadvies en verzoeken over het studieprogramma. Besluiten die de examencommissie neemt staan open voor een bezwaar- en beroepsprocedure. 

 

Voor de onderwijs coördinatoren ben je een eerste aanspreekpunt voor studenten met vragen van allerlei aard die je, als je ze niet zelf kan beantwoorden, doorzet naar de juiste collega’s binnen het EST TLS of naar een andere afdeling. Je verzorgt allerlei onderwijs gerelateerde activiteiten, bijvoorbeeld de toelating van studenten tot opleidingen die door TLS verzorgd worden, het organiseren van voorlichtings- en matchingsactiviteiten, diploma-uitreikingen, enzovoorts. 

 

Met betrekking tot de ondersteuning van de examencommissie draag je op proactieve wijze bij aan het functioneren van de examencommissie. Je taken zijn zeer divers, je houdt (beleids)beslissingen en de jaarkalender bij, monitort diverse deadlines in hoorzittingen en beroepsprocedures en zorgt voor een adequate procesbeheersing. Je zorgt voor het opzetten en uitvoeren van de nieuwsbrief en helpt bij het voorbereiden van vergaderingen. Je assisteert bij het proces rond het toets- en het scriptiepanel door het uitzoeken van scripties, het toedelen en het verzamelen van beoordelingen. 

 

Bovenstaande taken zullen in overleg verdeeld worden over alle collega’s Medewerkers Studentenzaken, daarbij is het uitdrukkelijk de bedoeling dat jullie elkaar ook kunnen helpen of vervangen. Aangezien het zwaartepunt van de werkzaamheden in de zomer valt verwachten we ook dat we in die periode op je kunnen rekenen.

hits.title: Hoofd dienst OSZ
hits.job_description:
De Faculteit der Geesteswetenschappen van de Universiteit Leiden is op zoek naar een

Hoofd Onderwijs- en Studentzaken (OSZ)

Die samen met de medewerkers van de dienst de onderwijsprocessen binnen de faculteit op professionele wijze ondersteunt en de dienst verder vormgeeft. Als Hoofd OSZ heb je een goed ontwikkeld gevoel voor bestuurlijke verhoudingen en de academische wereld. Je bent een verbinder en door samen te werken bereik je de gewenste verandering. Je geeft leiding aan het managementteam van de dienst, waarbij je jouw stijl van leidinggeven kunt aanpassen aan de situatie. Ook zorg je voor een sfeer waarin talenten tot hun recht komen. Je werkt als Hoofd OSZ samen met de afdelingshoofden van het Faculteitsbureau en onderhoudt contact met het centrale expertisecentrum Studenten- en Onderwijszaken. Als Hoofd OSZ heb je inzicht in en ervaring met het adviseren over en begeleiden van (verander-)processen in een complexe onderwijsomgeving.

Binnen de dienst OSZ vindt een doorontwikkelingstraject plaats waarbij de inrichting van de dienst(verlening) en de positionering van de dienst als partner in de onderwijsorganisatie centraal staan. In de komende periode worden hier belangrijke stappen in gezet. Als hoofd OSZ lever je hieraan een actieve bijdrage.

  • Je geeft integraal leiding aan (de medewerkers van) de dienst OSZ, en werkt daarvoor samen het OSZ-managementteam.
  • In de faculteit ben je het gezicht van de dienst OSZ en je vertegenwoordigt de faculteit en haar onderwijsbelangen actief binnen en buiten de Universiteit Leiden.
  • Voor het faculteitsbestuur en de opleidingsbesturen ben je adviseur en gesprekspartner; je fungeert als sparringpartner bij bestuurlijke en strategische vraagstukken ten behoeve van de onderwijsorganisatie en vervult daarbij in voorkomende gevallen een intermediërende rol.
  • Je bent lid van het facultaire managementteam bedrijfsvoering en draagt vanuit die positie bij aan een overstijgende visie op de facultaire dienstverlening.

  • Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de bedrijfsvoering van de dienst, zoals personele en financiële zaken.

hits.title: Businesscontroller F&C-team TLS (0,8 - 1,0 fte)
hits.job_description:
Als businesscontroller ben je verantwoordelijk voor de financiële planning & control cyclus van de gehele faculteit. Je stelt samen met je team begrotingen, prognoses en managementrapportages op en je hebt als sparringpartner een adviserende rol voor de business. De functie is breed, uitdagend en inhoudelijk zeer afwisselend. 

 

De divisie F&C is een van de zeven divisies binnen University Services en is verantwoordelijk voor financieel-economische beleidsadvisering, de planning en control cyclus en het beheer van de financieel-administratieve systemen en processen binnen de universiteit. F&C bestaat uit vijf afdelingen: Policy Staff, de nieuwe afdeling Business Control, Finance Service Center, Project Administration en Internal Financial Control. Bij F&C werken gedreven en deskundige professionals. De divisie wordt aangestuurd door de directeur F&C. Het is de ambitie van F&C om concreet aan de slag te gaan met de verdere ontwikkeling van Business Control en dit binnen de divisie te verankeren. 

 

Het F&C-team van TLS is onderdeel van de afdeling Business Control en is verantwoordelijk voor financial control met bijbehorende werkzaamheden die in de P&C-cyclus plaatsvinden binnen TLS, zoals het opstellen van de facultaire begroting, de jaarrekening en tussentijdse prognoses. Omdat financiële zaken niet op zichzelf staan maar zijn geworteld in de business adviseert de businesscontroller het management over de bedrijfsvoering en over strategische en tactische onderwerpen. 

 

Jouw werkzaamheden:

  • Verantwoordelijk voor de P&C-cyclus binnen de faculteit, zoals de begroting, prognoses en managementrapportages met bijbehorende analyses;
  • Je geeft leiding aan het F&C-team van TLS, bestaande uit 3 assistent-controllers;
  • Klantgericht adviseren en ondersteunen van het bestuur van de faculteit, opstellen van businesscases en het aanleveren van relevante managementinformatie;
  • Toegevoegde waarde leveren door knelpunten en risico’s te signaleren, zoeken naar oplossingen en adviseren over en uitvoeren van verbeteringen. Dit gaat van operationeel tot strategisch niveau;
  • Binnen de afdeling Business Control en de divisie F&C werk je mee aan het verder stroomlijnen en optimaliseren van de financiële processen.

hits.title: Vaardighedendocent Rechtsgeleerdheid B3 (0,1 – 0,3 fte)
hits.job_description:
Als vaardighedendocent rechtsgeleerdheid begeleid je onze studenten bij het ontwikkelen van hun schriftelijke en mondelinge vaardigheden. Je stoomt onze studenten klaar voor de juridische praktijk, door hen te leren zichzelf helder, overtuigend en op academisch verantwoorde wijze uit te drukken. Dit doe je met enthousiasme – jouw passie voor het vak deel je met onze studenten. Binnen jaar 3 is de ontwikkeling gericht op onderzoeksvaardigheden en het begeleiden van het bachelorwerkstuk (bachelorscriptie).

Je takenpakket er als volgt uit: tijdens het eerste deel van het jaar begeleid je bijeenkomsten (ca. 20 studenten per groep) waarin onderzoeksvaardigheden centraal staan en voorzie je onderzoeksvoorstellen van feedback en een beoordeling. Tijdens het tweede deel van het jaar begeleid je studenten in kleinere groepen bij het schrijven van hun bachelorwerkstuk. Hierbij ligt jouw focus op onderzoeks- en schrijfvaardigheid en werk je samen met een vakdocent die het juridisch inhoudelijke onderdeel voor haar rekening neemt.

De bijeenkomsten, afspraken met studenten, voorbesprekingen en nakijkoverleggen vinden op verschillende dagen van de week plaats. Er kunnen afspraken gemaakt worden over beschikbaarheid. De focus ligt op individuele feedback en beoordeling van de schriftelijke stukken. Deze werkzaamheden kun je flexibel indelen binnen de daarvoor bestemde periode, en kun je zowel op de campus als elders verrichten. Het doen van onderzoek behoort niet tot het takenpakket van een vaardighedendocent.

hits.title: Assistant Professor in Computational Law (0.8-1.0 fte)
hits.job_description:
You will be offered the opportunity to collaborate with data scientists and legal researchers, and to apply (and learn) data science methods and solutions in relation to the legal domain. The responsibilities are diverse. You will teach, conduct innovative and high-quality research, write research proposals, and participate in strategic and administrative activities. This set of responsibilities will, among other things, allow you to:

  • Grow in academia
  • Be a pioneer in the field of law and data science
  • Collaborate with experts from law as well as computer science
  • Perform individually and collaboratively
  • Build networks
  • Participate and lead projects
  • Pursue strategies to translate research results into innovation
  • Develop and advance courses and educational programs at the intersection of law and data science.

The application of computational methods in the legal domain will revolutionize legal academia and practice. There is a growing need to develop data infrastructures for the legal domain and to test methodologies for legal analysis in order to answer empirical research questions. This position helps address this need by contributing to cutting-edge research that applies data science and artificial intelligence to a legal or regulatory context.

We invite applications for a position at the Maastricht Law and Tech Lab, which closely collaborates with the Institute of Data Science and the Department of Knowledge Engineering at Maastricht University. It is an exciting and vibrant community where legal scholars and data scientists meet and form interdisciplinary teams that work at the intersection of Data Science and Law.

  • PhD degree in law, data science, artificial intelligence, computer science, mathematics, or a related field. Legal scholars with a doctrinal focus do not fit the profile;

  • Excellence in research and, preferably, a track record of obtaining research funding;

  • Fluency in the English language.

hits.employer_description:
Employer

Maastricht University

The Faculty of Law of Maastricht University provides challenging and high-quality legal education for Bachelor's and Master's students. The faculty is a pioneer in small-scale and innovative education and trains lawyers for both the national and international labor market. The faculty is in the top 3 of law schools in the EU and, with 51% foreign students, is the most international law faculty in Europe. It has 3000 students and more than 300 employees. Maastricht University provides you a unique international experience in a Dutch city.

The research within the faculty is conducted within one of the faculty research institutes and the Maastricht Graduate School of Law. The focus of the research is on European and international aspects of law, human rights, migration, and Law & Technology. hits.title: PhD position on mass transport modelling from GRACE/GRACE-FO data
hits.job_description:
The continued observation of the temporal changes of the Earth's gravity field is essential for understanding mass transport, caused by processes in the oceans and atmosphere, by melting ice caps and glaciers, by large-scale ground water use, among others. Mass transport is an essential climate variable, and its monitoring is required for understanding climate change. It is also crucial for monitoring hydrological processes at global and regional scales, thereby providing information for water security relevant for agriculture and drink water supply of billions of people worldwide. Space-borne gravimetry, notably in the form of the Gravity Recovery And Climate Experiment (GRACE), GRACE Follow-On missions, has provided observations covering two decades, but their full information content remains underutilized. Without fully exploiting the spatial and temporal resolution of gravimetric data, the ability to separate the underlying geophysical processes is not possible, crippling our understanding of the effects of climate change. 

This research aims at providing novel mass transport products derived from space-borne gravimetric data coming from past, current, and future missions. This is achieved by innovative methodology, namely by uniquely constraining the data from these missions to geophysical models, thereby combining the strength of the underlying physical knowledge contained in such models and maximising the spatiotemporal resolution of the satellite on-orbit observations. Auxiliary information, such as precipitation records or altimetry data, will establish a suitable temporal evolution, and topography and surface properties will predict a realistic spatial mass distribution. 

The successful candidate will transform the application of gravimetric data in the various geophysical domains by providing mass change estimates with unprecedented spatiotemporal resolution at specific geographical locations and focusing on particular geophysical processes. 

The successful candidate will be responsible for pre-processing the GRACE data, building the mass transport models at selected geographical regions, and validating and improving their parameterisation.

The successful candidate will also be involved in education as MSc student co-supervisor and/or as project coach.

hits.title: PhD position funerary customs in the Roman Near East(1.0 FTE)
hits.job_description:
Applications are invited for a fully funded, four-year PhD position within the research project “Mortuary Archaeology of the Roman East - MARE”, financed by the Dutch Research Council (NWO) and led by the PI, Dr Lidewijde de Jong.

During the first centuries CE, new forms of funerary display emerged in the cemeteries of the Roman Near East. Memories of the deceased were prolonged after death through portraits and epitaphs, monumental stone coffins, and roadside tombs. This project investigates how these forms of displaying the dead were embedded in mortuary rituals. Bringing legacy dataset anddigital archives together, we interrogate how local communities reformulated their relationships with the dead by personalizing the funerary spaces.

In collaboration with the other team members, you will work on your own project Rituals in Space: reconstructing funerary rituals through gifts and bones. This PhD project focuses on the activities that occurred in the space of the tomb, from the first burial and post-burial actions, to its closure or abandonment. Through the analysis of the spatial setting, grave gifts, and human remains, the different steps in funerary rituals are reconstructed. This will give insights into the shared beliefs that the communities drew on in the care for the dead. This research builds a framework in which the fragmented materials of the Roman Near East can be inserted. It addresses the project’s main question by outlining how people interacted with the dead through ritual actions, and the extent to which the new tomb elements altered these practices. The sample comes from Coastal Lebanon and Pisidia (Turkey) and consist of legacy and new data on the spatial setting of human remains, coffins, epitaphs, and gravegoods.

An outline of the complete project is available at: https://www.rug.nl/research/groningen-institute-of-archaeology/research/mare/

This PhD project offers a unique opportunity to work in an international research environment as well as to acquire valuable teaching experience: the PhD candidate is expected to conduct 0.3 fte teaching during the second, third and fourth year of their appointment (0.1 fte yearly).

You will be asked to:

• complete a dissertation on funerary customs in Roman Lebanon and Pisidia
• collect legacy and new data together with the principal investigator and other team members

• co-organize research meetings and an online exhibit

hits.title: Postdoc - How do microalgae grow and move within porous hydrogel environments?
hits.job_description:
Engineered living materials are hybrid structures composed of biological living cells, which are growing within a non-living matrix. The living cells within the matrix can endow the materials with a range of novel sense-and-respond functionalities.

The aim of this project is to exploit the light response of microalgae to provide responsive properties to a microalgae-based living material. To achieve this, the postdoc will investigate how the microalgae C. reinhardtii grows and moves within a porous hydrogel environment and how it responds to light in the context of such a confined environment. The role of specific proteins involved in mechanosensing and in surface adhesion will be examined by visualizing C. reinhardtii motion with time-lapse microscopy. The insights that we will gain on mechanosensing within a porous structure will enable us to better control the algae’s response by, for example, adjusting conditions affecting mechanosensing proteins or using genetic variants with altered mechanosensation.

With the support of technicians and experts in the research team, the postdoc will identify the characteristics of the cell movement as a function of the environmental conditions, genetic variation, and materials’ parameters. This will enable the rational design of strategies to control the living material response.
hits.requirements_description:
Requirements

Qualified candidates have a Ph.D. in either biophysics, cell biology, or a related field. hits.title: Promovendus: neurocognitieve ontwikkeling van kinderen met sikkelcelziekte
hits.job_description:
Wat ga je onderzoeken?
Dagelijks worden wereldwijd 1.000 kinderen met sikkelcelziekte geboren. Sikkelcelziekte is een erfelijke bloedziekte, waarbij de rode bloedcellen makkelijk kunnen veranderen in een sikkelcelvorm. Deze sikkelcellen zorgen voor obstructie in kleine bloedvaten waardoor het zuurstofrijke bloed niet goed aankomt bij organen en weefsels. Dit kan leiden tot allerlei ernstige levenslange complicaties, waaronder schade aan het hersenweefsel. Deze schade kan ernstige gevolgen hebben voor de ontwikkeling en het functioneren van kinderen met sikkelcelziekte waardoor hun kwaliteit van leven, schoolprestaties en carrière vooruitzichten beperkt worden. Daar komt bij dat sikkelcelziekte vaker voorkomt binnen reeds maatschappelijk benadeelde families met een migratieachtergrond. Dit onderzoek heeft als doel om vroegtijdig kinderen met sikkelcelziekte met een bedreigde ontwikkeling te identificeren zodat vroege interventies mogelijk worden.

De promovendus zal onderzoek uitvoeren in twee projecten (ONSET en BRICK):

Objective Neurocognitive Assessment of Young Children with Sickle Cell Disease by Eye-Tracking (ONSET)
Vanwege de bedreigde neurocognitieve ontwikkeling van kinderen met sikkelcelziekte is het van groot belang om deze beperkingen vroeg op te sporen, zodat de zorg voor deze kinderen daarop kan worden afgestemd. ONSET richt zich op het in kaart brengen van de vroege neurocognitieve ontwikkeling van jonge kinderen met sikkelcelziekte. In het onderzoek wordt gebruik gemaakt van een versneld longitudinaal design met eye-tracking bij kinderen van 4 tot 24 maanden. Eye-tracking is een veelbelovende methode om objectieve metingen van neurocognitieve functies te verrichten bij babies en peuters. In deze studie wordt tevens de predictieve waarde onderzocht van klinische karakteristieken (waaronder proteomics) voor de neurocognitieve ontwikkeling.

Brain Structure and Neurocognitive Development in Sickle Cell Disease (BRICK)

Vanwege de verstrekkende impact van sikkelcelziekte op de neurocognitieve ontwikkeling van kinderen is het belangrijk om de mechanismen die leiden tot neurocognitieve beperkingen in detail te begrijpen. De BRICK studie maakt gebruik van biomarkers en geavanceerde beeldvorming met MRI om meer inzicht te verkrijgen de onderliggende mechanismen van de neurocognitieve beperkingen. Het onderzoek richt zich op kinderen en jongeren met sikkelcelziekte tussen de 6 en 24 jaar. Dit onderzoek wordt samen met het Sophia Kinderziekenhuis (Erasmus MC) uitgevoerd, waarbij het Emma Kinderziekenhuis verantwoordelijk is voor de neurocognitieve metingen.

Wat ga je doen?
De afdeling Kinderhematologie en de Emma Neuroscience Group van het Emma Kinderziekenhuis (Amsterdam UMC) werken samen aan innovatief onderzoek dat is gericht op de vroege neurocognitieve ontwikkeling van kinderen met sikkelcelziekte. Hierbij wordt gebruik gemaakt van biomedische methoden (proteomics) en neurowetenschappelijke methoden (eye-tracking en computergestuurd neurocognitief onderzoek). De promovendus zal onderzoek uitvoeren in twee projecten (ONSET en BRICK).

Taakomschrijving
De vacante positie omvat onder andere de volgende taken:

  • Rekruteren van kinderen met sikkelcelziekte in het Emma Kinderziekenhuis;
  • Rekruteren van een gezonde controlegroep (4-24 maanden) via het consultatiebureau;
  • Supervisie van dan wel het uitvoeren van neurowetenschappelijke metingen (eye-tracking, neurocognitief testonderzoek);
  • Superviseren van master-studenten in het uitvoeren van metingen en het schrijven van een master-these;
  • Management van de datastromen die voortvloeien uit het beschreven onderzoek (in Castor);
  • Data-analyse middels verschillende softwarepakketten (SPSS, R);
  • Het schrijven van een proefschrift op basis van de resultaten uit de beschreven projecten.

hits.title: Technician in advanced in vitro bone modelling (1.0 FTE)
hits.job_description:
As a Technician in the Division of Pharmacology in the Utrecht Institute for Pharmaceutical Sciences, you will be responsible for the development of a 3D in vitro model of bone disease. Osteocytes, the major cells residing in bone, govern the rate at which old bone breaks down and new bone is being built. In certain diseases, such as chronic kidney disease (CKD), bone activity is disturbed, resulting in weak and brittle bones. However, little is known on why and how osteocytes are affected by the disease. In this project we aim to develop an in vitro model of osteocytes activity in CKD-specific conditions to better understand the biomolecular changes inflicted by the disease. The project involves the use of stem cells, cultured in 3D hydrogels that will be differentiated into osteocytes. Using biomolecular analysis (qPCR, ELISA, immunostainings) and mechanical testing (DMA), you will evaluate the activity of the osteocytes, cultured in healthy and diseased (plasma from CKD patients) conditions.

We believe this model will provide insights in osteocytes biology in CKD and will aid in the development of potential therapeutic targets. You will also evaluate the effect of emerging therapies on rescuing the cells from injury. The knowledge that we will acquire within this project will be at the base of several grant applications and collaborations with nephrologists and biomaterials engineers. This position is partially funded by NWO-XS (package 21-4).

The objectives for this position are:

  • establish the 3D cultures of osteocytes (from stem cells and commercial cell line);
  • analyse the biomolecular signature of differentiated osteocytes (under exposure to uremic stimuli);
  • evaluate bone formation (matrix and mineralization).


Additionally, you will be integrated within the technical cluster and provide support in the cell culture facility.

Led by Yasemin Vardar, the Haptic Interface Technology Lab aim to create natural,
compelling, and customizable haptic interactions in virtual environments. For this aim, we investigate skin deformations that occur during interactions with natural surfaces or tactile interfaces and the resulting perceptual experiences and design new haptic interfaces and rendering algorithms.

- Design and evaluation of experimental setups or novel devices for delivering touch
feedback,
- Programming of an experimental setup for understanding touch interactions,
- Preparing and conducting research studies with human subjects,
- Collecting and analyzing sensor data (e.g., force sensor data, camera images),
- Assistance with organizing and using lab equipment among lab members.
The research engineer position will allow you to be involved in ongoing haptics research, as well as gain hands-on experience with software/ hardware systems and human-subject experiments. The concrete position and tasks are subject to discussion with interested candidates.

hits.title: Associate Professor Global Performance History
hits.job_description:
Do you enjoy working in an interdisciplinary research setting and do you want to be active in a variety of educational programmes? The Amsterdam School of Historical Studies is looking for a dynamic and ambitious associate professor Global Performance History. ASH is one of the five Research Schools within the Amsterdam Institute for Humanities Research. ASH represents and fosters the study of the human past from Antiquity to the present day. It brings together more than 200 academics from Amsterdam’s Faculty of Humanities, who participate in ca. 25 research groups.

You will be based in the department Art and Culture Studies, in the Theatre Studies group. Art and Culture Studies is a large academic department that connects research and teaching in Art History, Heritage and Memory Studies, Museum Studies, Cultural Studies, Book Studies, Music Studies, and Theatre Studies and appreciates interdisciplinary collaborations. Theatre Studies includes a BA and a MA programme, a Dual Master International Dramaturgy and is part of the Research Master Art and Performance Studies.

To strengthen its senior staff, the department of Art and Culture Studies invites applications for an associate professor Global Performance History.

What are you going to do

You will provide teaching in a dynamic context with ample opportunities for the development of innovative teaching methods. You will contribute to ASH with research activities related to the historical dimensions of performance cultures, including theatre, dance, rituals and everyday life performances, departing from global, transnational and transcultural historical perspectives. We are particularly looking for candidates with expertise in historical performance practices in its various facets (textual, embodied, spatial, etc.), preferably with respect to colonial encounters and the ways these encounters shaped the West and Non-West alike.  

You are expected to take a leading role in the ASH research group Historical Theatre Research: Text, Performance, and Production of Knowledge, developing new terrains of research and envisioning an inspiring and relevant future research agenda. Moreover, you will be actively involved in inter- and transdisciplinary historical research at the UvA, establishing and seeking out co-operations with scholars in the history of religion, art history, architecture, musicology and cultural studies. You will collaborate with archival and artistic institutions in The Netherlands and abroad. 

The successful candidate will teach and develop innovative teaching activities both as part of and outside the programme of the Theatre Studies group, which includes the Bachelor and Master programmes Theatre Studies, the Dual MA Program International Dramaturgy and the Research Master program Art and Performance Studies. Preferably, you will contribute to develop interdisciplinary reaching activities together with staff members from other groups in the Art and Culture Studies department. He or she will supervise both bachelor and master students, as well as PhD’s.

The candidate will independently conduct research in the areas mentioned, resulting in contributions to leading international publications. The candidate will be expected to raise funds for and be involved in (international) research projects. You will also take an active role in other research activities, ranging from research seminars to board memberships and grant applications. Finally, the candidate will expected play a role in the departmental organization, taking responsibility, together with the professor holding the Chair of Theatre Studies, for a administrative and managerial duties within and outside the department of Art and Culture Studies.

Tasks and responsibilities:

  • conducting independent research in historical performance studies from a global perspective, resulting in academic publications in peer-reviewed international journals and/or books;
  • actively pursuing external funding for research, notably funding from research councils, national as well as international;
  • actively contributing to and developing national and international research networks and other forms of cooperation;
  • actively contributing to the research activities of ASH;
  • developing, coordinating and teaching courses in both Dutch and English, in the bachelor and master programmes;
  • supervising Bachelor and Master theses and tutoring students; co-supervising PhD theses;
  • actively contributing to the development and improvement of the broader teaching programmes in the department;
  • taking part in committees and working groups and carrying out departmental administrative tasks as directed.

You are able to position your research in comparative and transhistorical studies of performance, and can develop (new) historiographic approaches, especially out of a global perspective, with a critical attitude towards Western epistemic systems. An interest in theories and practices of archiving and curating intangible heritage as well as an openness towards new avenues of research in historical digital humanities is expected.

hits.job_description:
We seek a creative developer to build an innovative science prototype pipeline to combine data from multiple astronomical/astroparticle observatories with advanced theoretical models, for the first time, into a fully integrated and statistically correct treatment.  

The project will be carried out within the context of the European project ESCAPE (European Science Cluster of Astronomy & Particle Physics ESFRI research infrastructures) that brings together the communities of astronomy, astroparticle and particle physics with the goal to develop open-science platforms and multi-messenger big data infrastructure that is open and FAIR, and to make software interoperable and open source. As part of this effort, another goal is to build a domain-specific European Open Science Cloud (EOSC).  

What are you going to do

This position is part of the European research project UE H2020 'EOSC Future', specifically to develop a prototype scientific analysis pipeline for the 'Extreme Universe' test science projects. The selected candidate will work together with teams involved in EOSC Future and ESCAPE Future, primarily within the science data teams of the Cherenkov Telescope Array (CTA) next generation very-high-energy gamma-ray facility, and KM3NeT, the next generation ocean-based neutrino detector.

hits.title: Assistant Professor Practical Philosophy in Medical Ethics and Politics of Health
hits.job_description:
The Philosophy and Public Affairs group covers a broad field of expertise in practical philosophy. The group seeks to strengthen its profile by hiring a candidate that (a) has a solid background in either political and social philosophy or ethics (b) the ability to connect socio-political themes with ethical perspectives c) a research focus on a contemporary, urgent and topical issue. In the last decade, fueled by bio-technological developments, issues of bioethics have become more and more pertinent, facing us with an ever more complex set of analytical and normative tasks. In addition, the corona-pandemic has once again shown the importance of questions of a just distribution of health care and the effects of health policies, our views on the value of human life, our images of wellbeing, illness and recovery, as well as intricate bioethical questions such as triage. Given these challenges, we are therefore looking for a colleague with a specialization in Medical Ethics and the Politics of Health. 

What are you going to do?

You will provide education in a dynamic context with ample opportunities for the development of innovative teaching methods. Your research will be part of the Amsterdam School for Cultural Analysis (ASCA), one of the five research schools of the Amsterdam Institute for Humanities Research. ASCA is home to more than 100 researchers and more than 140 PhD candidates, and conducts world-leading research in Cultural Analysis. ASCA members share a commitment to studying culture in all its forms and expressions within an interdisciplinary framework, and to maintaining a close connection with contemporary cultural and political debates. All ASCA research fits into at least one, but usually more than one of five thematic constellations: 1) Mediality; 2) Arts & Aesthetics; 3) Globalization & Migration; 4) Identities; and 5) Cultural & Social Critique. Across these constellations, ASCA is seeking to build expertise in the Medical Humanities.

The position will be embedded within the department of Philosophy in the capacity group Philosophy and Public Affairs (PPA). Philosophy and Public Affairs examines classical questions in the area of practical philosophy, such as the foundations of ethics and sociopolitical philosophy, in light of new and topical problems.

Tasks and responsibilities

  • Designing and conducting independent research on Medical Ethics and the Politics of Health resulting in academic publications in peer-reviewed international journals and/or books.
  • Actively pursuing external funding for research, notably funding from research councils, national as well as European.
  • Actively contributing to and developing national and international research networks and other forms of cooperation.
  • Actively contributing to the interdisciplinary research activities of ASCA.
  • Developing, coordinating and teaching courses in both Dutch and English, in the Bachelor and Master programmes.
  • Supervising Bachelor and Master theses and tutoring students; co-supervising PhD theses.

hits.title: Assistant Professor in Medieval History of Asia and/or Africa
hits.job_description:
We seek an Assistant Professor in Medieval History of Asia and/or Africa to provide education in a dynamic context with ample opportunities for the development of innovative teaching methods. Your research will be part of the Amsterdam School of Historical Studies (ASH), one of the five research schools of the Amsterdam Institute for Humanities Research. ASH represents and fosters the study of the human past from Antiquity to the present day. It brings together more than 200 academics from Amsterdam’s Faculty of Humanities, who participate in ca. 25 research groups. Depending on your expertise, you will join one of the research groups/centres within ASH, for example those on environmental history or urban history. You will also help foster a dialogue between colleagues working on medieval histories and cultures of Europe.

The position will be embedded within the department of History, European Studies & Religious Studies in the capacity group History. Historians at the UvA explore history in all its breadth and complexity.

What are you going to do?

Tasks and responsibilities:

  • designing and conducting independent research in the field of Medieval History of Asia and/or Africa, with a strong preference for transregional approaches, including the history of slavery, migration, and/or environmental history, resulting in academic publications in peer-reviewed international journals and/or books;
  • actively pursuing external funding for research, notably funding from research councils, national as well as European;
  • actively contributing to and developing national and international research networks and other forms of cooperation;
  • actively contributing to the research activities of the Amsterdam School of Historical Studies and the National Research School for Medieval studies;
  • developing, coordinating and teaching courses, in Dutch and English, in the Bachelor and (Research) Master programmes in History;
  • supervising Bachelor and Master theses and tutoring students; co-supervising PhD theses;
  • actively contributing to the development and improvement of the broader teaching programmes in the Department;
  • taking part in committees and working groups, and carrying out departmental administrative tasks.

hits.title: Project Manager (0.8 - 1.0 FTE)
hits.job_description:
Would you like to work on cutting edge scientific research and manage large-scale and international projects? Are you interested in how our environment (exposome) influences our health? We are looking for an enthusiastic, independent and driven Project Manager to strengthen the Exposome Support Office.
As a Project Manager at the Exposome Support Office of the Institute for Risk Assessment Sciences (IRAS, Department Population Health Sciences) you will play a crucial role in supporting exposome research. The Institute for Risk Assessment Sciences has a leading position on international exposome research. We combine applied and fundamental research on both the internal and external exposome, data science, and clinical expertise. The Exposome Support Office, established in January 2020, coordinates several large-scale (inter)national exposome research projects, including the European project EXPANSE, which will be the main focus of your work. EXPANSE focuses on the urban exposome, the complex interplay between the built, social, physico-chemical, food, and lifestyle aspects of the urban environment. By studying the impact of the urban exposome on Cardio-Metabolic and Pulmonary Disease, EXPANSE will address one of the most pertinent questions for urban planners, policy makers, and European citizens: “How to maximize one’s health in a modern urban environment?” This large-scale project runs from January 2020 to January 2025 and involves 20 academic and non-academic partners, located in 14 European countries and the USA. The project has received funding from the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme and is part of the Human Exposome Network, the world’s largest network of projects studying the impact of environmental exposure on human health.

The Project Manager forms an integral part of the Exposome Support Office. In addition to EXPANSE, you will also be involved in the management of other exposome projects, such as EIRENE, and Exposome-Scan. As our Project Manager, you are responsible for supporting, monitoring and guarding a smooth, effective and timely execution of project plans, its progress and its budget. You will manage all administrative processes, which include (financial) planning and reporting, monitoring and control, contract management and compliance, archive management, and project meeting organization. You work in close collaboration with the scientific project leaders and principal investigators, as well as other support staff, and serve as the main point of contact for our partners and funding agencies. You will help develop and execute project meetings and assist in (the organization of) dissemination activities like workshops, webinars, conferences and publications, together with the other support staff. Scoping new funding initiatives and supporting the preparation of new grant applications is also part of your work.

Mooi werk
Wij zijn op zoek naar twee onderzoekers AI in het veiligheidsdomein. Ben jij er één van?

Als ervaren onderzoeker weet je veel over onderzoek in jouw expertisedomein en wil je deze kennis graag delen met het onderwijs en het werkveld. Vanuit je inhoudelijke en methodologische expertise ben je sparringpartner voor de lectoren binnen het Avans-zwaartepunt Veilig en Veerkrachtige Stad en Omgeving. Jij zet samen met hen onderzoeksprojecten op en ontwikkelt het zwaartepunt zelf door. Als verbinder betrek je daar het werkveld, docenten en studenten bij en stimuleer je de samenwerking met onderzoekers van andere projecten. Net zo gemakkelijk zet je jouw netwerk in of zoek je naar mogelijkheden om je netwerk verder uit te breiden. Jij rust niet voordat de resultaten van je onderzoek zijn verwerkt in het onderwijs en in toepassingen voor het werkveld. Je deelt de ontwikkelde kennis graag met de wetenschap.

Ook de bedrijfsvoeringskant van de projecten behoort tot je taken, inclusief de verantwoording aan opdrachtgever of subsidieverstrekker. Dankzij de kwaliteit van je werk, volgen extern gefinancierde vervolgprojecten (bijna) als vanzelf.

Gezien de samenstelling van het team zoeken wij specifiek twee nieuwe collega’s met twee specifieke kennis en ervaring: één voor de expertise over ethiek in relatie tot AI voor sociale en fysieke veiligheid in de stedelijke omgeving en één de expertise die zich toespitst op het vergroten van de handelingsperspectieven van professionals in het veiligheidsdomein voor het toepassen van AI in hun eigen werk en dat van burgercollectieven.

hits.title: Science Analysis Pipeline Developer for Multi-Messenger Data Analysis Tools
hits.job_description:
We seek a creative developer to build an innovative science prototype pipeline to combine data from multiple astronomical/astroparticle observatories with advanced theoretical models, for the first time, into a fully integrated and statistically correct treatment.  

The project will be carried out within the context of the European project ESCAPE (European Science Cluster of Astronomy & Particle Physics ESFRI research infrastructures) that brings together the communities of astronomy, astroparticle and particle physics with the goal to develop open-science platforms and multi-messenger big data infrastructure that is open and FAIR, and to make software interoperable and open source. As part of this effort, another goal is to build a domain-specific European Open Science Cloud (EOSC).  

What are you going to do

This position is part of the European research project UE H2020 'EOSC Future', specifically to develop a prototype scientific analysis pipeline for the 'Extreme Universe' test science projects. Theoretical models of astrophysics sources produce predictions of radio through gamma-ray fluxes as well as neutrino fluxes, however there is currently no tool that can statistically assess goodness of fit to all data types simultaneously. The goal of the project is to develop a prototype pipeline for model comparison to photon and neutrino flux data simultaneously, accounting for the various instrument responses.

The selected candidate will work together with teams involved in EOSC Future and ESCAPE Future, primarily within the science data teams of the Cherenkov Telescope Array (CTA) next generation very-high-energy gamma-ray facility, and KM3NeT, the next generation ocean-based neutrino detector.

  • knowledge of software engineering principles and tools for configuration management, bug reporting, etc.
  • good communication in English (written & oral) and interpersonal skills. 
  • ability to work both independently and within teams in an international environment. 

Additional competences a plus:

  • experience with the Scientific Python Stack (e.g. Numpy/SciPy/Pandas/Jupyter) and domain-specific tools like gammapy, astropy and/or 3ML.
  • experience with astroparticle, X-ray and/or high-energy physics data.
  • interest in professional-quality software design and data modelling.

The Faculty of Science and Institute of Environmental Sciences  are looking for:

Postdoctoral fellow Industrial Ecology | Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) of Electric Mobility (0.8-1.0 fte; 2-3 years)

Vacancy number: 22-078

Key responsibilities

The electrification of road transportation using renewable energy to fuel electric vehicles (EV) is seen as an important contribution to meet climate targets. The postdoctoral researcher will take part in an upcoming EU Project called TranSensus, which aims at developing a European-wide harmonised transport-specific LCA approach. Through collaboration with the automotive, battery and other important industrial stakeholders as well as key research institutes on this topic, state-of-the-art methodological guidance will be developed in this project to provide fair sustainability assessments for electric vehicles and their supply chains. The focus at Leiden University will be on environmental Life Cycle Assessment (LCA), while social and economic aspects will be considered by partners. Within the project, a variety of mobility scenarios will be developed and assessed over their full life cycle to develop and test a harmonized approach to LCA and LCSA. The ideal starting date would be April-May 2022.

hits.title: Assistant / Associate Professor in Digital Communication Science (Tenure Track)
hits.job_description:
Are you highly motivated to understand communication in an increasingly digital society and advance the use of computational social sciences? Are you focused on addressing social challenges in dynamic and polarized media environments? Are you interested in communication with a focus on life science?

The Strategic Communication (COM) group is looking for a hardworking and ambitious assistant/associate professor in Communication science with a focus on or interest in life science. In this position, you are responsible for the coordination, organization, and implementation of new research activities on the application of innovative approaches of computational social sciences in communication research. We expect you to generate external financial support for an innovative research agenda. You are interested in (global) challenges in life science domains (e.g., health, climate change, and sustainable consumption). As our new colleague, you will critically explore and contribute to the understanding of how data-driven approaches in digital communication contexts can impact and contribute to broader individual and collective shifts in these life science domains. This includes, but is not limited to:
  • studying communication in online media, especially with regard to understanding digital communication mechanisms, processes of polarization and/or the presence and effects of mis- and disinformation;
  • computational data collections and analysis to study a digital media environment;
  • evaluating the reach, content, and impact of digital communication campaigns in life science contexts.
Furthermore, we challenge you to motivate and teach students and to be involved in the innovation of our education. A part of the teaching duties includes the development of two courses in the new master specialization 'Data science for health promotion', in cooperation with other chair groups. This interspecialization will be further developed into a full master's program at Wageningen University. You are expected to work with students from various programs, supervise them in the use of digital data approaches in communication, and support them in executing coherent research projects. We provide you with training and mentoring to accomplish all of this.

You prefer inter- or transdisciplinary approaches and an international orientation. To address current problems and solutions, societal engagement (e.g., with governments, societal actors, and researchers) is both a topic for analysis, as well as an approach to work with society in teaching and research projects.

As an assistant/associate professor you are able to navigate between and connect to the interdisciplinary fields of computational science as well as strategic communication. As such, you feel comfortable with a wide range of perspectives present in both communication science and computational science.
Tenure Track is a career path for hardworking scientists who pursue to excel in education and research. We seek to attract scientific talent and to stimulate and support their development.
hits.requirements_description:
Requirements

You are an ambitious scientist and a standout colleague, dedicated to research and education within our broad field of expertise. To further strengthen our group, you:
  • hold a PhD in a relevant social science field- or discipline (e.g., communication science, (social) psychology, sociology, political science, anthropology, etc.);
  • are an inspiring teacher and student supervisor with enthusiasm for teaching and working with students in an international setting;
  • have experience with communication research on online media, including new or social media; and have a proven track record in using innovative methods, in particular, computational approaches such as automated content analysis or digital tracing;
  • have a strong international and interdisciplinary orientation;
  • have an excellent publication record relative to your stage of career;
  • possess the capacity or potential of acquiring, leading, and managing externally-funded research projects;
  • are committed to achieving societal impact in relation to important social challenges;
  • enjoy working together with your colleagues and possess good management skills;
  • adhere (or have a willingness to adhere) to the principles of Open Science.
This position requires excellent English language proficiency (a minimum of CEFR C2 level). For more information about this proficiency level, please visit our special language page.
hits.conditions_description:

This challenging career path starts at the level of assistant professor, from which you can grow into an associate professor and furthermore grow to personal professor position. Depending on your experience and track record, you can enter at various levels.

Wageningen University & Research offers excellent terms of employment. A few highlights from our Collective Labour Agreement include:
  • sabbatical leave, study leave, and paid parental leave;
  • working hours that can be discussed and arranged so that they allow for the best possible work-life balance;
  • the option to accrue additional holiday hours by working more, up to 40 hours per week;

In addition to these first-rate employee benefits, you will be offered a fixed-term, 7 year contract which, upon positive evaluation based on criteria elaborated in the University's Tenure Track policy, can lead to a permanent employment contract as professor. Your salary will depend on expertise and experience and the maximum gross salary for Assistant Professors is â¬5.826,- per month and for Associate Professors the salary can grow up to â¬6.940,- per month. Both based on a full working week of 38 hours in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreements for Dutch Universities (CAO-NU).
Wageningen University & Research encourages internal advancement opportunities and mobility with an internal recruitment policy. There are plenty of options for personal initiative in a learning environment, and we provide excellent training opportunities. We are offering a unique position in an international environment with a pleasant and open working atmosphere.
