hits.title: Lector Ondermijning
hits.job_description:
U stelt een onderzoeksplan op, werft opdrachten, onderhoudt contacten met de beroepspraktijk en wetenschap en begeleidt docenten en studenten in hun ontwikkeling.

Mooi werk
U werkt voor een vernieuwd lectoraat van het oude Expertisecentrum Veiligheid (EV). U wilt binnen dit thema kennis ontwikkelen door het (laten) verrichten van praktijkgericht onderzoek, waarbij u ervoor zorgt dat de inhoudelijke en methodologische kwaliteit van het onderzoek goed is en de wisselwerking tussen onderzoek, onderwijs en werkveld optimaal. Dit doet u door kenniskringen met docent-onderzoekers in te richten en hen te coachen. Door studenten en professionals een leeromgeving aan te bieden. En door in- en extern op te treden als expert en kwaliteitsdrager van allerlei onderzoeksgerelateerde zaken. U werft extern gefinancierde projecten die passen in de context van het onderwijs en het onderzoeksthema.

De kern van het onderzoek van het lectoraat is het inzichtelijk maken hoe processen en mechanismen van ondermijning werken, welke rol burgers, professionals en hun organisaties daarbij spelen en hoe deze weerbaarder gemaakt kunnen worden tegen deze ontwikkelingen. Ondermijning wordt gedefinieerd als de ontwrichting van maatschappelijke structuren en fundamenten en aantasting van de rechtstaat, door verwevenheid van onderwereld en bovenwereld, als gevolg van of verbonden met georganiseerde criminaliteit. Ondermijnende criminaliteit is vooral een economisch gedreven maatschappelijk fenomeen.

Bij de aanpak van ondermijnende criminaliteit zijn veel partijen betrokken op verschillende niveaus. De insteek van de aanpak is al even divers en hangt samen met de variëteit aan partijen. Belangrijke spelers zijn de opsporingsdiensten en het openbaar ministerie, de belastingdienst en lokale overheden, maar ook professionals in het sociaal domein, de zorg en bijvoorbeeld woningcorporaties. Elk van de betrokken partijen heeft zijn eigen instrumentarium, gekoppeld aan bevoegdheden en expertise. De sleutel tot een effectieve aanpak ligt in samenwerking tussen partijen en de uitwisseling van informatie en expertise.

En hierin ligt dan ook de kern van de onderzoeksopgave van dit lectoraat:

  • Het vergroten van de weerbaarheid van professionals, dienstverleners en branches. Door zelf weerbaar te zijn tegen directe ondermijnende activiteiten, maar ook door het signaleren van ondermijnende activiteiten en hiertegen in actie te komen
  • Het vergroten van de weerbaarheid van burgers: welke factoren stimuleren en belemmeren de meldingsbereidheid aan de overheid en hoe zijn deze te beïnvloeden.
  • Het versterken van de samenwerking tussen betrokken organisaties voor het creëren van meer impact dan alleen voldoen aan de eisen van ieders eigen organisatie: hoe om te gaan met de effectiviteit van het instrumentarium van elke partner t.o.v. elkaar? Hoe te komen tot ‘ons’ instrumentarium? Wat vereist dat van de professionals en de organisaties van de toekomst?

In de eerste termijn van het lectoraat zijn drie onderzoekslijnen ontwikkeld, samen met de beroepspraktijk en het onderwijs: Indicatoren ten behoeve van vroegsignalering van ondermijning met gebruik van data, Weerbaarheid van het openbaar bestuur en Burgerparticipatie.

Voor de komende lectoraatsperiode is met de stakeholders nagegaan waar de grootste kennisbehoefte uit bestaat: de huidige thema’s zijn nog steeds actueel. hits.title: Associate Professor Global Performance History
hits.job_description:
Do you enjoy working in an interdisciplinary research setting and do you want to be active in a variety of educational programmes? The Amsterdam School of Historical Studies is looking for a dynamic and ambitious associate professor Global Performance History. ASH is one of the five Research Schools within the Amsterdam Institute for Humanities Research. ASH represents and fosters the study of the human past from Antiquity to the present day. It brings together more than 200 academics from Amsterdam’s Faculty of Humanities, who participate in ca. 25 research groups.

You will be based in the department Art and Culture Studies, in the Theatre Studies group. Art and Culture Studies is a large academic department that connects research and teaching in Art History, Heritage and Memory Studies, Museum Studies, Cultural Studies, Book Studies, Music Studies, and Theatre Studies and appreciates interdisciplinary collaborations. Theatre Studies includes a BA and a MA programme, a Dual Master International Dramaturgy and is part of the Research Master Art and Performance Studies.

To strengthen its senior staff, the department of Art and Culture Studies invites applications for an associate professor Global Performance History.

What are you going to do

You will provide teaching in a dynamic context with ample opportunities for the development of innovative teaching methods. You will contribute to ASH with research activities related to the historical dimensions of performance cultures, including theatre, dance, rituals and everyday life performances, departing from global, transnational and transcultural historical perspectives. We are particularly looking for candidates with expertise in historical performance practices in its various facets (textual, embodied, spatial, etc.), preferably with respect to colonial encounters and the ways these encounters shaped the West and Non-West alike.  

You are expected to take a leading role in the ASH research group Historical Theatre Research: Text, Performance, and Production of Knowledge, developing new terrains of research and envisioning an inspiring and relevant future research agenda. Moreover, you will be actively involved in inter- and transdisciplinary historical research at the UvA, establishing and seeking out co-operations with scholars in the history of religion, art history, architecture, musicology and cultural studies. You will collaborate with archival and artistic institutions in The Netherlands and abroad. 

The successful candidate will teach and develop innovative teaching activities both as part of and outside the programme of the Theatre Studies group, which includes the Bachelor and Master programmes Theatre Studies, the Dual MA Program International Dramaturgy and the Research Master program Art and Performance Studies. Preferably, you will contribute to develop interdisciplinary reaching activities together with staff members from other groups in the Art and Culture Studies department. He or she will supervise both bachelor and master students, as well as PhD’s.

The candidate will independently conduct research in the areas mentioned, resulting in contributions to leading international publications. The candidate will be expected to raise funds for and be involved in (international) research projects. You will also take an active role in other research activities, ranging from research seminars to board memberships and grant applications. Finally, the candidate will expected play a role in the departmental organization, taking responsibility, together with the professor holding the Chair of Theatre Studies, for a administrative and managerial duties within and outside the department of Art and Culture Studies.

Tasks and responsibilities:

  • conducting independent research in historical performance studies from a global perspective, resulting in academic publications in peer-reviewed international journals and/or books;
  • actively pursuing external funding for research, notably funding from research councils, national as well as international;
  • actively contributing to and developing national and international research networks and other forms of cooperation;
  • actively contributing to the research activities of ASH;
  • developing, coordinating and teaching courses in both Dutch and English, in the bachelor and master programmes;
  • supervising Bachelor and Master theses and tutoring students; co-supervising PhD theses;
  • actively contributing to the development and improvement of the broader teaching programmes in the department;
  • taking part in committees and working groups and carrying out departmental administrative tasks as directed.

You are able to position your research in comparative and transhistorical studies of performance, and can develop (new) historiographic approaches, especially out of a global perspective, with a critical attitude towards Western epistemic systems. An interest in theories and practices of archiving and curating intangible heritage as well as an openness towards new avenues of research in historical digital humanities is expected.

hits.title: Science Analysis Pipeline Developer for Multi-Messenger Data Analysis Tools
hits.job_description:
We seek a creative developer to build an innovative science prototype pipeline to combine data from multiple astronomical/astroparticle observatories with advanced theoretical models, for the first time, into a fully integrated and statistically correct treatment.  

The project will be carried out within the context of the European project ESCAPE (European Science Cluster of Astronomy & Particle Physics ESFRI research infrastructures) that brings together the communities of astronomy, astroparticle and particle physics with the goal to develop open-science platforms and multi-messenger big data infrastructure that is open and FAIR, and to make software interoperable and open source. As part of this effort, another goal is to build a domain-specific European Open Science Cloud (EOSC).  

What are you going to do

This position is part of the European research project UE H2020 'EOSC Future', specifically to develop a prototype scientific analysis pipeline for the 'Extreme Universe' test science projects. Theoretical models of astrophysics sources produce predictions of radio through gamma-ray fluxes as well as neutrino fluxes, however there is currently no tool that can statistically assess goodness of fit to all data types simultaneously. The goal of the project is to develop a prototype pipeline for model comparison to photon and neutrino flux data simultaneously, accounting for the various instrument responses.

The selected candidate will work together with teams involved in EOSC Future and ESCAPE Future, primarily within the science data teams of the Cherenkov Telescope Array (CTA) next generation very-high-energy gamma-ray facility, and KM3NeT, the next generation ocean-based neutrino detector.

hits.title: Assistant Professor Practical Philosophy in Medical Ethics and Politics of Health
hits.job_description:
The Philosophy and Public Affairs group covers a broad field of expertise in practical philosophy. The group seeks to strengthen its profile by hiring a candidate that (a) has a solid background in either political and social philosophy or ethics (b) the ability to connect socio-political themes with ethical perspectives c) a research focus on a contemporary, urgent and topical issue. In the last decade, fueled by bio-technological developments, issues of bioethics have become more and more pertinent, facing us with an ever more complex set of analytical and normative tasks. In addition, the corona-pandemic has once again shown the importance of questions of a just distribution of health care and the effects of health policies, our views on the value of human life, our images of wellbeing, illness and recovery, as well as intricate bioethical questions such as triage. Given these challenges, we are therefore looking for a colleague with a specialization in Medical Ethics and the Politics of Health. 

What are you going to do?

You will provide education in a dynamic context with ample opportunities for the development of innovative teaching methods. Your research will be part of the Amsterdam School for Cultural Analysis (ASCA), one of the five research schools of the Amsterdam Institute for Humanities Research. ASCA is home to more than 100 researchers and more than 140 PhD candidates, and conducts world-leading research in Cultural Analysis. ASCA members share a commitment to studying culture in all its forms and expressions within an interdisciplinary framework, and to maintaining a close connection with contemporary cultural and political debates. All ASCA research fits into at least one, but usually more than one of five thematic constellations: 1) Mediality; 2) Arts & Aesthetics; 3) Globalization & Migration; 4) Identities; and 5) Cultural & Social Critique. Across these constellations, ASCA is seeking to build expertise in the Medical Humanities.

The position will be embedded within the department of Philosophy in the capacity group Philosophy and Public Affairs (PPA). Philosophy and Public Affairs examines classical questions in the area of practical philosophy, such as the foundations of ethics and sociopolitical philosophy, in light of new and topical problems.

Tasks and responsibilities

  • Designing and conducting independent research on Medical Ethics and the Politics of Health resulting in academic publications in peer-reviewed international journals and/or books.
  • Actively pursuing external funding for research, notably funding from research councils, national as well as European.
  • Actively contributing to and developing national and international research networks and other forms of cooperation.
  • Actively contributing to the interdisciplinary research activities of ASCA.
  • Developing, coordinating and teaching courses in both Dutch and English, in the Bachelor and Master programmes.
  • Supervising Bachelor and Master theses and tutoring students; co-supervising PhD theses.
  • Actively contributing to the development and improvement of the broader teaching programmes in the department.

hits.job_description:

  • Building a research team and a network of collaborators.

Then the job of Full professor in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Auditing at the University of Amsterdam is perfect for you!

What are you going to do

Research

You will establish a research line in the new and challenging topic of AI and Auditing. This could either lead to automating the auditing process (e.g., through combinations of multiple data sources) or methods for auditing AI algorithms (fairness, accountability, responsibility, ethics). It will connect existing research within the UvA and complement it with new topics at the crossroads of AI and auditing. In addition to a solid funding you will seek extension in its funding to enhance the research line, where given the topic of the position we particularly expect funding from public-private partnerships for example in the form of an Innovation Center for Artificial Intelligence (ICAI) lab. You will present and publish the scientific work at leading international conferences and journals. 

Education

You will contribute to teaching in existing programs at both the Faculty of Science (computer science) and and the Faculty of Economics and Business (accounting). But you are especially expected to start new initiatives in AI4Fintech, defining programs in close collaboration with industry to assure that the programs yield the students that have the profile the industry needs now and the academics that can create the innovations of the future. Teaching  tasks may be executed in (post) master accounting programs,  masters artificial intelligence, computational finance and beyond.  The total teaching load will not exceed 40% of total workload.

Valorization

You will actively pursue to have the research go beyond scientific publications and have a noticeable impact on society and business. Apart from participating in public private partnerships this also means a presence in the media. Transferring research into spinoff companies will be valued and actively supported.

Management

This position will be part of the AI4Fintech research program of the University of Amsterdam which is composed of a financial risk and a non-financial risk theme. hits.title: Assistant Professor Practical Philosophy in Medical Ethics and Politics of Health
hits.job_description:
The Philosophy and Public Affairs group covers a broad field of expertise in practical philosophy. The group seeks to strengthen its profile by hiring a candidate that (a) has a solid background in either political and social philosophy or ethics (b) the ability to connect socio-political themes with ethical perspectives c) a research focus on a contemporary, urgent and topical issue. In the last decade, fueled by bio-technological developments, issues of bioethics have become more and more pertinent, facing us with an ever more complex set of analytical and normative tasks. In addition, the corona-pandemic has once again shown the importance of questions of a just distribution of health care and the effects of health policies, our views on the value of human life, our images of wellbeing, illness and recovery, as well as intricate bioethical questions such as triage. Given these challenges, we are therefore looking for a colleague with a specialization in Medical Ethics and the Politics of Health. 

What are you going to do?

You will provide education in a dynamic context with ample opportunities for the development of innovative teaching methods. Your research will be part of the Amsterdam School for Cultural Analysis (ASCA), one of the five research schools of the Amsterdam Institute for Humanities Research. ASCA is home to more than 100 researchers and more than 140 PhD candidates, and conducts world-leading research in Cultural Analysis. ASCA members share a commitment to studying culture in all its forms and expressions within an interdisciplinary framework, and to maintaining a close connection with contemporary cultural and political debates. All ASCA research fits into at least one, but usually more than one of five thematic constellations: 1) Mediality; 2) Arts & Aesthetics; 3) Globalization & Migration; 4) Identities; and 5) Cultural & Social Critique. Across these constellations, ASCA is seeking to build expertise in the Medical Humanities.

The position will be embedded within the department of Philosophy in the capacity group Philosophy and Public Affairs (PPA). Philosophy and Public Affairs examines classical questions in the area of practical philosophy, such as the foundations of ethics and sociopolitical philosophy, in light of new and topical problems.

Tasks and responsibilities

  • Designing and conducting independent research on Medical Ethics and the Politics of Health resulting in academic publications in peer-reviewed international journals and/or books.
  • Actively pursuing external funding for research, notably funding from research councils, national as well as European.
  • Actively contributing to and developing national and international research networks and other forms of cooperation.
  • Actively contributing to the interdisciplinary research activities of ASCA.
  • Developing, coordinating and teaching courses in both Dutch and English, in the Bachelor and Master programmes.
  • Supervising Bachelor and Master theses and tutoring students; co-supervising PhD theses.
  • Actively contributing to the development and improvement of the broader teaching programmes in the department.
  • Taking part in committees and task forces and carrying out departmental administrative tasks as directed.
hits.requirements_description:

What do you have to offer?

The ideal candidate has a strong training in practical philosophy, including the history of the field, as well as a specialization in Medical Ethics and Politics of Health, engaging with issues such as bioethics and biopolitics, health justice, disability, the ethics and politics of care, or clinical ethics. The ability to situate these questions within a broader framework and to combine them with related questions such as human rights, ecology, analyses of capitalism, gender relations or disability studies is especially welcome. We expect the candidate to be highly interested in interdisciplinary collaboration within ASCA and other research schools, combining philosophical inquiry with sociological, cultural, and political analysis. The role of philosophy will be relevant in enriching an interdisciplinary cooperation with a normative perspective. hits.title: Postdoc on the project: high frame rate echography of the heart
hits.job_description:
The current research line of high frame rate echography contains several projects, bringing high frame rate echography to the limit and beyond. We can slow down all fast cardiac motion and thus compile the full picture on the complex and adaptive cardiac beating, which encompasses blood flow, muscular motion, and blood perfusion. The postdoc is to further develop the techniques and bring them towards a preclinical (animal) study, to volunteers, and/or to pilot studies with patients. We have several technical implementations of the high frame technique, including a fully-programmable research scanner and high-end clinical scanners programmed to the needs of these projects.

Pre-clinical study
We will use 2D and 3D contrast-enhanced high frame rate imaging in a pre-clinical study to compare myocardial perfusion to gold-standard angiography around the left ventricle after induced ischemia (30 mins of occlusion vs. 2 h of occlusion, where no-reflow is expected for the second group but not the first). Pre-clinical experiments will be performed in close collaboration with the department of Experimental Cardiology.

Clinical study
In a pilot study (order of 45 subjects) we will use the perfusion measurements on volunteers and patients. We have a functioning framework for these 2D and 3D high frame rate techniques, including testing on performance.

For all tasks described above, the postdoc will be organising these experiments and overviewing the execution, and analysing the results in terms of both technical and physiological implication and relevance. Furthermore, the postdoc will contribute to the overall aims of the projects including national and international conference presentations, MSc and PhD supervision, and project reporting.

The work is part of the NWO-VIDI "QUANTO" project granted by the Dutch national research funding agency. These efforts aim at developing the technique from idea to bedside within 5 years, and will run both at the Erasmus MC University Medical Center Rotterdam and Delft University of Technology. The team consists of multi-disciplinary partners including PhD students, engineers and cardiologists and is supported by industry.

The research project should result in several peer-reviewed scientific publications.

hits.title: PhD position Roman sarcophagi in Lebanon (1.0 FTE)
hits.job_description:
Applications are invited for a fully funded, four-year PhD position within the research project “Mortuary Archaeology of the Roman East - MARE”, financed by the Dutch Research Council (NWO) and led by the PI, dr. Lidewijde de Jong.

During the first centuries CE, new forms of funerary display emerged in the cemeteries of the Roman Near East. Memories of the deceased were prolonged after death through portraits and epitaphs, monumental stone coffins, and roadside tombs. This project investigates how these forms of displaying the dead were embedded in mortuary rituals. Bringing legacy dataset anddigital archives together, we interrogate how local communities reformulated their relationships with the dead by personalizing the funerary spaces.

In collaboration with the other team members, you will work on your own project Encoffined Bodies: decorated sarcophagi in funerary customs in Coastal Lebanon. Burial in stone coffins, many decorated in relief, was a popular practice in the Near East under Roman rule. Being part of a funerary context, the coffins played a role in the proper care for and remembrance of the deceased. As a container for the corpse - simultaneously protecting the body and hiding its disintegration- it speaks directly to concepts of the body held by the burying community, and to the role of the materiality of the coffin and its decoration in the care for the dead. This PhD project investigates the ritual function of sarcophagi in their material, epigraphic, and pictorial setting. The research concentrates on the coast of Lebanon, which had a long history of use of coffin burials. Legacy collections from older excavations and epigraphic or art historical surveys form the core dataset. Contextual data comes from recent rescue excavations, such as those in Beirut.

An outline of the complete project is available at: https://www.rug.nl/research/groningen-institute-of-archaeology/research/mare/

This PhD project offers a unique opportunity to work in an international research environment as well as to acquire valuable teaching experience: the PhD candidate is expected to conduct 0.3 fte teaching during the second, third and fourth year of their appointment (0.1 fte yearly).

You will be asked to:

• complete a dissertation on the ritual function of sarcophagi in Roman Lebanon
• collect legacy and new data together with the principal investigator and other team members
• assist other team members in developing the visual/iconographic components of the project’s digital database
• co-organize research meetings and an online exhibit
• contribute to the project’s public outreach and social media activities
• participate in GIA, ARCHON, and other related events
• conduct a limited amount of teaching.

hits.title: PhD student on genetic factors for obesity
hits.job_description:
Obesity is a global health care problem and forms a major risk factor for metabolic comorbidities such as diabetes, cardiovascular disease, and cancer. While the obesogenic environment has contributed to increased obesity rates, genetic factors modulate the susceptibility for obesity. Our research within the Obesity Center CGG (Centrum Gezond Gewicht) shows that obese patients frequently harbor genetic mutations or variants as an underlying cause of their obesity. Studies show that common polymorphisms in genes implicated in severe obesity modulate body mass index (BMI) and the risk for obesity in the general population.

In this project we aim to analyze the association of variants of genes involved in the leptin-melanocortin system and novel identified obesity-related pathways with BMI and obesity-related health issues (such as type 2 diabetes, cardiovascular disease) using population-based cohorts and translate results to our clinical obesity cohort.

hits.title: Arts onderzoeker TURN-COVID
hits.job_description:
Wat ga je onderzoeken?

Nieuwe antivirale middelen kunnen een mogelijk keerpunt zijn in de preventie en behandeling van patiënten met COVID-19. TURN-COVID is een nationale cohortstudie gericht op het gebruik van neutraliserende monoklonale antilichamen en andere antivirale SARS-CoV-2 middelen als therapie tegen COVID-19. Doel van de studie is om het gebruik, effectiviteit, veiligheid en kosten van de verschillende middelen in kaart te brengen in een Nederlandse setting. Ook onderzoeken we de virale kinetiek, het mogelijke ontstaan van nieuwe SARS-CoV-2 mutanten tijdens therapie en de antistofrespons. Bovendien creëren we een landelijk platform om toekomstige nog niet geregistreerde behandelingen van COVID-19 te evalueren.

We verzamelen klinische gegevens en nemen vragenlijsten af bij patiënten die behandeld worden met monoklonale antilichamen en andere antivirale middelen tegen SARS-CoV-2. In een aantal centra verrichten we de biobank studie waarbij we neus-mond swabs en bloed verzamelen op verschillende tijdspunten om de virale kinetiek, het eventuele ontstaan van nieuwe virus varianten en de antistofrespons te onderzoeken.

Momenteel loopt de TURN-COVID studie in meer dan twintig Nederlandse ziekenhuizen. De TURN-COVID studie wordt geleid door hoofdonderzoekers Prof. Joost Wiersinga (internist-infectioloog) en Dr. Godelieve de Bree (internist-infectioloog) en projectleider Dr. Emma Birnie (postdoc en arts in opleiding tot internist). Je zal nauw samenwerken met verschillende promovendi, een onderzoeksverpleegkundige en medische studenten. Het initiatief is tot stand gekomen met steun van de SWAB, RIVM, Nederlandse Vereniging van Ziekenhuisapothekers, GGD, Stichting HIV monitoring, en verschillende wetenschappelijke- en patiëntenverenigingen en wordt gesubsidieerd door ZonMw. 

Wat ga je doen?

Als promovendus op dit project zal je verantwoordelijk zijn voor het uitvoeren van de TURN-COVID studie. De werkzaamheden zijn zeer afwisselend.

Concreet houd jij je hierbij voornamelijk bezig met:

  • Coördineren van een multi-center studie
  • Includeren van patiënten
  • Gegevens verzamelen in de deelnemende centra
  • Laboratorium analyses van verzamelde sampels
  • Data analyse middels verschillende softwarepakketten (bv R)
  • Beantwoorden en analyseren van welomschreven onderzoeksvragen
  • Presenteren van resultaten op (internationale) congressen
  • Schrijven van wetenschappelijke publicaties en een proefschrift
  • Superviseren van studenten

hits.title: Onderwijskundige bij Marketing & Communicatie
hits.job_description:
Wij zoeken een gedreven onderwijskundige die ons tijdelijk komt versterken voor het (door)ontwikkelen van onderwijsprogramma’s. De doelstelling van deze programma’s is om leerlingen kennis te laten maken met wetenschap en hen goed voor te bereiden op een academische studie.

Als onderwijskundige ben je verantwoordelijk voor het ontwerpen en ontwikkelen van leertrajecten voor leerlingen van het basis- en/of voortgezet onderwijs of het ontwikkelen van professionalisering voor docenten. Het doel van de leertrajecten of professionalisering die jij ontwerpt is om de onderwijskansen van leerlingen te vergroten door aandacht te besteden aan:

  • studievaardigheden: leerlingen nieuwe vaardigheden leren op gebied van leren leren,  onderzoek doen (onderzoekend leren) en redeneren;
  • studiehouding: de bereidheid tot leren vergroten;
  • persoonlijke ontwikkeling: leerlingen vaardigheden leren die bijdragen aan persoonlijk leiderschap en talentontwikkeling;
  • navigatie vaardigheden: leerlingen vaardigheden leren die eraan bijdragen om een eigen pad te kiezen, hen te laten kennismaken met de universiteit en hen te leren de regie te nemen over hun eigen loopbaan.

Door jouw academische kennis ben je in staat om vernieuwende onderwijsconcepten te introduceren aansluitend bij de doelgroep.

Onze missie: Samen bouwen aan de wereld van morgen

Als werkgever wil de Erasmus Universiteit Rotterdam een waardevolle bijdrage leveren aan maatschappelijke uitdagingen van deze tijd. Dat doen we samen met onze 3.500 academici en professionals en 30.000 studenten uit 140 landen. Met een open blik op de wereld en met aandacht voor diversiteit van achtergronden en opvattingen werken onze wetenschappers en onderzoekers, docenten, studenten en professionals nauw samen aan het oplossen van maatschappelijke vraagstukken. Dit doen we onder het motto Making Minds Matter, wat staat voor onze ambities, zowel wetenschappelijk als maatschappelijk.

Wat de Erasmus Universiteit Rotterdam onderscheidt is in de eerste plaats de manier waarop we dat doen: the Erasmian Way. Dit staat voor wereldburgerschap, maatschappelijke betrokkenheid, verbindend, ondernemend en ruimdenkend. Het zijn onze wetenschappers, docenten, professionals en studenten die deze kernwaarden belichamen en dagelijks positieve maatschappelijke impact hebben op de wereld om hen heen. Net als onze naamgever willen we een duurzame bijdrage leveren aan de oplossing van actuele maatschappelijke vraagstukken. 

Je gaat werken in het team Brand & Campaigns, één van de vier teams binnen de afdeling Marketing & Communicatie. Dat team is inhoudelijk verantwoordelijk voor het Wetenschapsknooppunt en het verbeteren van de aansluiting tussen het voortgezet en het hoger onderwijs. In de uitvoering werk je nauw samen met collega’s van andere teams binnen M&C en met andere afdelingen binnen de universiteit.

Het wetenschapsknooppunt Erasmus Universiteit Rotterdam (WK|EUR) brengt Wetenschap en Onderzoekend Leren naar de klas in het primair en voortgezet onderwijs. Doel is om de relatie tussen de Erasmus Universiteit en het basis- en voortgezet onderwijs te versterken door leerlingen, (aankomend) leerkrachten en wetenschappers samen te brengen rondom wetenschap en onderzoek. Om dit te bereiken ontwikkelt het WK|EUR oriënterende en verrijkende lesmodules voor leerlingen tussen de 8 en 18 jaar en professionaliseringsactiviteiten voor hun docenten. De wetenschappelijke onderzoekscyclus is het uitgangspunt in de lessen, waarin gewerkt wordt aan onderzoekend leren, academische vaardigheden, 21e-eeuwse vaardigheden en life skills. Het WK|EUR bestaat uit drie medewerkers: een projectmanager en twee event managers. Het WK|EUR werkt samen met onderzoekers van de universiteit en met EUR-studenten die lessen verzorgen op scholen.

De werkzaamheden op het gebied van aansluiting richten zich op het verbeteren van de aansluiting tussen het voortgezet onderwijs en de universiteit aan de hand van (vaardigheids)onderwijs, docentprofessionalisering en samenwerking met partners in de regio.

Taken en verantwoordelijkheden

Als onderwijskundige zijn dit jouw taken en verantwoordelijkheden:

  • Jij bent onderwijskundig ontwikkelaar en adviseur voor alle projecten van het wetenschapsknooppunt en aansluiting.
  • Je ontwikkelt lesmaterialen waardoor leerlingen in het primair en voortgezet onderwijs kennismaken met en enthousiast worden over wetenschap.
  • Je ontwikkelt vaardigheidsonderwijs voor vo-leerlingen en startende studenten op gebied van studievaardigheden en life skills die de transitie van het voortgezet onderwijs naar het hoger onderwijs faciliteert. Leerlingen rapporteren na het volgen van dit onderwijs dat zij het gevoel hebben dat zij beter zijn voorbereid op studeren in het hoger onderwijs.
  • Je ontwikkelt docent-professionaliseringen voor leerkrachten uit het basisonderwijs en docenten uit het voortgezet onderwijs om hen bekend te maken met belangrijke academische vaardigheden en onderzoek doen.
  • Je vernieuwd bestaand lesmateriaal en zorgt voor doorontwikkeling waar nodig en loopt daarbij vooruit op de trends in het onderwijs.
  • Je bent medeverantwoordelijk voor het plannen en organiseren van onderwijsevenementen en professionaliseringen.
  • Je onderhoud relaties met partners in de stad (musea, bedrijven, gemeente etc.) en zoekt actief partners om mee samen te werken.
  • Je neemt zitting in diverse werkgroepen in de regionale samenwerkingsverbanden die werken aan een soepele overgang van het VO naar het HO, vanuit jouw onderwijskundige expertise ben je verantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen van producten, diensten en activiteiten die ondersteunend zijn aan die doelstelling. Dit doe je samen met andere onderwijsprofessionals van onze partners.
  • Je brengt verschillende betrokken partijen samen: docenten van de deelnemende scholen, wetenschappers van de EUR, student-docenten van de EUR en partners in de stad (musea en bedrijven).

hits.title: Team leader Data Science Team
hits.job_description:
Do you love to work with a highly skilled, enthusiastic and international team of data scientists? Are you keen about developing team members and the team? Are you just as passionate about creating more knowledge from data as we are? We have a vacancy for a team leader to lead the Data Science Team (16 fte) at Wageningen Food Safety Research (WFSR).

WE ARE LOOKING FOR
The use of data science is crucial to improve the safety of our food and feed. Within WFSR we have created a new data science team combining a broad range of skills and knowhow to apply data science in the domain of food safety. As team manager of the data science team, you are responsible for (developing) the team and the team members and also for the research and projects carried out by the team.

The team leader:
  • is part of the management team of the business unit and you contribute to the development and implementation of the strategic plans of the business unit with your colleague team leaders;
  • is responsible for HR tasks such as implementing HR policy, absenteeism supervision, training and development plan, etc.
  • is responsible for monitoring the scientific and technical quality of the research;
  • builds and maintains valuable relationships with other teams, experts, research institutes, food authorities, and companies;
  • acts as a motivated ambassador for data science and the WFSR data science team - within WFSR, WUR and beyond and by doing so acquires projects for the team;
  • ensures that the projects placed within the data science team are implemented WFSR-wide where necessary/meaningful and plans the capacity of the team members in the projects.
In our projects we use machine learning and artificial intelligence, bioinformatics, (big) data analytics, programming, image processing, and data visualisation. For example, we develop emerging risk identification systems to identify (un)known hazards in the food supply chain. We have used artificial intelligence technologies for the identification of chemicals that may be used in food supplements that were not known to us yet. We develop bioinformatics methods to improve the discovery and characterization of microbial pathogens in the food chain.
The global food system faces many challenges with the changing climate, the need for sustainability, the changing societal demands, and the vulnerability of the integrity of the food system.
hits.requirements_description:
Requirements

We are looking for a team leader:
  • Who has an Msc degree and a good understanding of doing research and working in a research organization.
  • Who has a solid understanding of data science and the benefits of the different techniques and tools that are being used. Someone who is able to evaluate the merits of the work and has a vision of the future projects.
  • Who has shown excellent people management skills and loves to coach and stimulate the further development of the professionals in the team.

hits.title: Technician in advanced in vitro bone modelling (1.0 FTE)
hits.job_description:
As a Technician in the Division of Pharmacology in the Utrecht Institute for Pharmaceutical Sciences, you will be responsible for the development of a 3D in vitro model of bone disease. Osteocytes, the major cells residing in bone, govern the rate at which old bone breaks down and new bone is being built. In certain diseases, such as chronic kidney disease (CKD), bone activity is disturbed, resulting in weak and brittle bones. However, little is known on why and how osteocytes are affected by the disease. In this project we aim to develop an in vitro model of osteocytes activity in CKD-specific conditions to better understand the biomolecular changes inflicted by the disease. The project involves the use of stem cells, cultured in 3D hydrogels that will be differentiated into osteocytes. Using biomolecular analysis (qPCR, ELISA, immunostainings) and mechanical testing (DMA), you will evaluate the activity of the osteocytes, cultured in healthy and diseased (plasma from CKD patients) conditions.

We believe this model will provide insights in osteocytes biology in CKD and will aid in the development of potential therapeutic targets. You will also evaluate the effect of emerging therapies on rescuing the cells from injury. The knowledge that we will acquire within this project will be at the base of several grant applications and collaborations with nephrologists and biomaterials engineers. This position is partially funded by NWO-XS (package 21-4).

The objectives for this position are:

  • establish the 3D cultures of osteocytes (from stem cells and commercial cell line);
  • analyse the biomolecular signature of differentiated osteocytes (under exposure to uremic stimuli);
  • evaluate bone formation (matrix and mineralization).


Additionally, you will be integrated within the technical cluster and provide support in the cell culture facility.

hits.title: Promovendus "kwaliteit van routine zorgdata" 1,0 fte voor 4 jaar
hits.job_description:
Functie 
Binnen de academische werkplaats ‘kwaliteit van huisartsen en ziekenhuiszorg’ zoeken wij een promovendus voor het project ‘kwaliteit van routine zorgdata’. Het project wordt uitgevoerd vanuit Tranzo, onderdeel van de Tilburg School of Social and Behavioral Sciences van Tilburg University. 

 

Achtergrond
Ons zorgstelsel brengt een groeiende hoeveelheid gegevens voort. Declaraties, elektronische patiëntendossiers, gezondheids-apps. Die gegevens worden gebruikt in het zorgproces zelf, maar steeds vaker ook voor onderzoek en statistiek. Maar zijn die gegevens daar eigenlijk wel voor geschikt? En hoe kom je daar achter? Welke factoren bevorderen of belemmeren de kwaliteit van gegevens? En hoe kun je de kwaliteit van gegevens verbeteren? Dit zijn vragen waarmee je je gaat bezig houden als promovendus. 

 

Wat ga je doen? 
De invulling van je promotietraject ligt nog niet vast. De eerste taak is dan ook het uitwerken van de ideeën die daarover bestaan bij jou en je begeleiders. Je werk bestaat uit desk-research, literatuuronderzoek, analyse van grote gegevensbestanden, praten met zorgverleners, patiënten en beleidsmakers. Zo kun je bijvoorbeeld gebruik maken van declaratiebestanden en gegevens uit elektronische patiëntendossiers van zorgverleners. Je werkt samen met onderzoekers bij het Nivel en bij het Zorginstituut en je onderhoudt betrekkingen met andere relevante partijen. Een deel van het werk zal betrekking hebben op gegevens die verzameld worden in Nivel Zorgregistraties eerste lijn en gegevens uit zorgdeclaraties.

hits.title: PhD position on mass transport modelling from GRACE/GRACE-FO data
hits.job_description:
The continued observation of the temporal changes of the Earth's gravity field is essential for understanding mass transport, caused by processes in the oceans and atmosphere, by melting ice caps and glaciers, by large-scale ground water use, among others. Mass transport is an essential climate variable, and its monitoring is required for understanding climate change. It is also crucial for monitoring hydrological processes at global and regional scales, thereby providing information for water security relevant for agriculture and drink water supply of billions of people worldwide. Space-borne gravimetry, notably in the form of the Gravity Recovery And Climate Experiment (GRACE), GRACE Follow-On missions, has provided observations covering two decades, but their full information content remains underutilized. Without fully exploiting the spatial and temporal resolution of gravimetric data, the ability to separate the underlying geophysical processes is not possible, crippling our understanding of the effects of climate change. 

This research aims at providing novel mass transport products derived from space-borne gravimetric data coming from past, current, and future missions. This is achieved by innovative methodology, namely by uniquely constraining the data from these missions to geophysical models, thereby combining the strength of the underlying physical knowledge contained in such models and maximising the spatiotemporal resolution of the satellite on-orbit observations. Auxiliary information, such as precipitation records or altimetry data, will establish a suitable temporal evolution, and topography and surface properties will predict a realistic spatial mass distribution. 

The successful candidate will transform the application of gravimetric data in the various geophysical domains by providing mass change estimates with unprecedented spatiotemporal resolution at specific geographical locations and focusing on particular geophysical processes. 

The successful candidate will be responsible for pre-processing the GRACE data, building the mass transport models at selected geographical regions, and validating and improving their parameterisation.

The successful candidate will also be involved in education as MSc student co-supervisor and/or as project coach.

hits.title: Project Manager (0.8 - 1.0 FTE)
hits.job_description:
Would you like to work on cutting edge scientific research and manage large-scale and international projects? Are you interested in how our environment (exposome) influences our health? We are looking for an enthusiastic, independent and driven Project Manager to strengthen the Exposome Support Office.
As a Project Manager at the Exposome Support Office of the Institute for Risk Assessment Sciences (IRAS, Department Population Health Sciences) you will play a crucial role in supporting exposome research. The Institute for Risk Assessment Sciences has a leading position on international exposome research. We combine applied and fundamental research on both the internal and external exposome, data science, and clinical expertise. The Exposome Support Office, established in January 2020, coordinates several large-scale (inter)national exposome research projects, including the European project EXPANSE, which will be the main focus of your work. EXPANSE focuses on the urban exposome, the complex interplay between the built, social, physico-chemical, food, and lifestyle aspects of the urban environment. By studying the impact of the urban exposome on Cardio-Metabolic and Pulmonary Disease, EXPANSE will address one of the most pertinent questions for urban planners, policy makers, and European citizens: “How to maximize one’s health in a modern urban environment?” This large-scale project runs from January 2020 to January 2025 and involves 20 academic and non-academic partners, located in 14 European countries and the USA. The project has received funding from the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme and is part of the Human Exposome Network, the world’s largest network of projects studying the impact of environmental exposure on human health.

The Project Manager forms an integral part of the Exposome Support Office. In addition to EXPANSE, you will also be involved in the management of other exposome projects, such as EIRENE, and Exposome-Scan. As our Project Manager, you are responsible for supporting, monitoring and guarding a smooth, effective and timely execution of project plans, its progress and its budget. You will manage all administrative processes, which include (financial) planning and reporting, monitoring and control, contract management and compliance, archive management, and project meeting organization. You work in close collaboration with the scientific project leaders and principal investigators, as well as other support staff, and serve as the main point of contact for our partners and funding agencies. You will help develop and execute project meetings and assist in (the organization of) dissemination activities like workshops, webinars, conferences and publications, together with the other support staff. Scoping new funding initiatives and supporting the preparation of new grant applications is also part of your work.

hits.title: Postdoc - How do microalgae grow and move within porous hydrogel environments?
hits.job_description:
Engineered living materials are hybrid structures composed of biological living cells, which are growing within a non-living matrix. The living cells within the matrix can endow the materials with a range of novel sense-and-respond functionalities.

The aim of this project is to exploit the light response of microalgae to provide responsive properties to a microalgae-based living material. To achieve this, the postdoc will investigate how the microalgae C. reinhardtii grows and moves within a porous hydrogel environment and how it responds to light in the context of such a confined environment. The role of specific proteins involved in mechanosensing and in surface adhesion will be examined by visualizing C. reinhardtii motion with time-lapse microscopy. The insights that we will gain on mechanosensing within a porous structure will enable us to better control the algae’s response by, for example, adjusting conditions affecting mechanosensing proteins or using genetic variants with altered mechanosensation.

With the support of technicians and experts in the research team, the postdoc will identify the characteristics of the cell movement as a function of the environmental conditions, genetic variation, and materials’ parameters. This will enable the rational design of strategies to control the living material response.

hits.title: PhD Position Machine Learning & Weather Modelling
hits.job_description:
Optical communication is a rapidly evolving field. It has numerous applications in a diverse range of fields; from self-driving cars to satellite communication. However, various atmospheric phenomena including optical turbulence, cloud, fog, precipitation adversely impact optical communication. To circumvent these issues, researchers from Delft University of Technology (TUD), Royal Netherlands Meteorological Institute (KNMI) and other collaborators are working together to develop novel data-driven atmospheric models. Their research is funded by a major multi-institutional initiative called "Optical Wireless Super Highways". We are looking for a PhD student who will join our team and conduct cutting-edge research in machine learning-based weather modelling for optical communication use cases. 

Both TUD and KNMI provide an academic research environment in meteorology, earth observation and data science, to address various challenging meteorological issues pertaining to optical communication.

hits.title: PhD Student – Senior Friendly Care Trajectories (1,0 fte)
hits.job_description:
We are recruiting a PhD candidate for a project on senior friendly care trajectories. You will will combine the scientific disciplines of Health Service Operations Management (HSOM) and Integrated Care to perform research on senior friendly care trajectories. With the aging of the population the number of patients with multi-morbidity is increasing. Older persons are living longer at home and frequently require a combination of cure, (home) care and social support. Episodes of hospital care, planned admissions or emergency situations, may entail changes in the care after discharge. Transfers between institutions and the home setting, as well as integration of care at home require planning and coordination to ensure continuity and quality of care for the patient. Delivering the right care on the right place at the right time ensures senior friendly and cost effective care with reablement as main aim. Reablement is “a person-centred, holistic approach that aims to enhance an individual's physical and/or other functioning, to increase or maintain their independence in meaningful activities of daily living at their place of residence and to reduce their need for long-term services”[1].  This may not only require optimizing the existing care organization, but also improving the care provision by developing innovative ways for care delivery and for transfers between institutional and home care.

Health Service Operations Management (HSOM) traditionally focusses on high production levels and efficiency, but shifted towards a more process-oriented approach with attention for the patient. However, until now, operations management research has mostly focused on institutional care, especially hospital care, and has paid less attention to care in the community and care in networks, while the number of days people stay in an institution is decreasing. This implies that applying OM approaches to primary care and to the home environment of patients create opportunities to enrich the knowledge base and transfer knowledge to new settings. An approach that focusses on the connection between primary and secondary care, and the alignment of care at home, whilst taking the network of the patient into consideration, is Integrated Care. Integrated Care research both focusses on patient populations, such as older persons, as on a specific disease, e.g. Diabetes or COPD. The expectation is that combining concepts and approaches of operations management and Integrated care will lead to possibilities to improve care for older persons living at home or nursing homes and add to delivering the right care on the right place at the right timeand reablement.

The research will be conducted in the province of Zeeland in close collaboration with healthcare organizations and professionals in that region. The PhD is expected to translate real life problems in the care trajectories in Zeeland into research that will benefit reablement and the optimization of care for older persons. As such the PhD will be member of the Academic Collaborative Centre Older Persons Care Zeeland (AWOZ), a collaborative network of health and research institutions. Information on AWOZ can be found on the following website: https://www.awoz.nl/

Finally, you will teach in the education programs of Erasmus School of Health Policy & Management (about 15% of your time).

What are you going to do

You will provide education in a dynamic context with ample opportunities for the development of innovative teaching methods. Your research will be part of the Amsterdam School of Historical Studies (ASH), one of the five research schools of the Amsterdam Institute for Humanities Research. ASH represents and fosters the study of the human past from Antiquity to the present day. It brings together more than 200 academics from Amsterdam’s Faculty of Humanities, who participate in ca. 25 research groups. Depending on your expertise, you will join one of the research groups/centres within ASH, for example those on urban history or modern history, and/or help establish a new research group focused on public history.

The position will be embedded within the department of History, European Studies & Religious Studies in the capacity group History. Historians at the UvA explore history in all its breadth and complexity.

Tasks and responsibilities:

  • designing and conducting independent research in the field of Public History of Slavery in the Early Modern or Modern Period, resulting in academic publications in peer-reviewed international journals and/or books;
  • actively pursuing external funding for research, notably funding from research councils, national as well as European;
  • actively contributing to and developing national and international research networks and other forms of cooperation;
  • actively contributing to and developing meaningful interactions with museums, heritage sites, cultural institutions, government agencies and communities on (interpretations of) slavery’s history in the public arena;
  • actively contributing to the research activities of the Amsterdam School of Historical Studies;
  • developing, coordinating and teaching courses, in Dutch and English, in the Bachelor and (Research) Master programmes in History;
  • supervising Bachelor and Master theses and tutoring students; co-supervising PhD theses;
  • actively contributing to the development and improvement of the broader teaching programmes in the department;
  • taking part in committees and working groups, and carrying out departmental administrative tasks.
hits.requirements_description:

You are a dynamic, ambitious and innovative researcher with a strong profile, demonstrable by international publications and an international academic network. Your publications show a broad knowledge of and engagement with either the public production of relevant histories (in the form of exhibitions, films or other public projects) and/or a research focus analyzing the traces of the history of slavery in, for example, the built environment, monuments and museum collections, or representations of this past in popular culture. Your work is interdisciplinary, with attention to innovative approaches to material culture and the archive. Your research matches the profile of the Amsterdam School of Historical Studies.

You are able to develop and provide disciplinary and interdisciplinary modules on the history of slavery in the Early Modern or Modern Period and/or the legacy of slavery in modern society, in the Netherlands, Europe, South America or North America, within the Bachelor and Master programmes in History. In particular, you will contribute to the further development of the UvA Public History and/or American Studies MA track. Important is proven flexibility in teaching topics beyond your own research focus, a willingness to work in interdisciplinary teams and the ability to offer inspiring lectures and tutorials in the BA, MA and minor programmes that could attract a wide range of students.

Optical communication is a rapidly evolving field. It has numerous applications in a diverse range of fields; from self-driving cars to satellite communication. However, various atmospheric phenomena including optical turbulence, cloud, fog, precipitation adversely impact optical communication. To circumvent these issues, researchers from Delft University of Technology (TUD), Royal Netherlands Meteorological Institute (KNMI) and other collaborators are working together to develop novel data-driven atmospheric models. Both TUD and KNMI provide an academic research environment in meteorology, earth observation and data science, to address various challenging meteorological issues pertaining to optical communication.

The role

 As a project manager, it is your responsibility to bring our projects to a timely and successful end.

  • Acquisition:
    You play an important role in connecting to our ecosystem on the Brightlands Smart Services Campus in Heerlen. This includes the active acquisition of new projects and identifying & analyzing opportunities. You represent BISS in regular meetings to connect the different stakeholders. The acquisition is a shared responsibility between the project manager, BISS’ Principal Investigators (Professors from Maastricht University who are part of the BISS team), and BISS’ Managing Director. 
  • Project definition:
    You support the BISS Principal Investigators in formulating draft project definitions and deliverables. The PI’s act as Product Owners and are responsible for the content of the project definition, whereas you are responsible for making sure there are definitions and deliverables in place before the project commences, and that there is a realistic timeline in which milestones are defined.
  • Project management:
    The projects that you manage, are carefully planned, and progress is monitored. We currently use a SCRUM board, but you are explicitly welcome to make this role your own by implementing your preferred processes.
  • Leading the project:
    You select the right team members, based on expertise and availability. You motivate and coach the project members. You ensure that their roles are well-defined and that everyone’s responsibilities are clear. You are their first point of contact regarding the project. You lead the team members, as well as the meetings with different stakeholders. You have the authority to decide on how to prioritize tasks within the project definition and within budget. In case of larger desired changes of scope or budget, you decide together with the Managing Director (MD).
  • Project Reporting:
    Not only do you ensure that customers and partners receive an end-report and evaluate the project with us, you pro-actively identify additional ways to give the project external visibility. You actively use your lessons learned to make the next project better, smoother, or more successful. You monitor the project budget, together with MD and PI.
  • Developing the team:
    You are the project manager for our most strategic, or larger projects. At the same time, you develop the project management skills of the researchers and developers in the BISS team, so that they can do project management for smaller projects themselves. You implement joint processes and approaches and share best practices, to support the team. You advise them when needed, without taking over.

hits.title: Post-doc on data-guided circular strategies for circular ICT in businesses
hits.job_description:
The department of Sustainable Design Engineering (SDE) is looking for a post-doctoral researcher (2 years) to do research on tools for data-driven adoption of circular ICT solutions in businesses.

Design for Sustainability (DfS) is a research group with design for the circular economy as one of its core focal areas. Research aims at the development of methods and tools that enable the design of products that have multiple lifecycles. This research area explores circular design strategies, such as product life-extension, reuse, remanufacturing and recycling, and the technologies and business models that enable these strategies. Knowledge and Intelligence Design (KInD) is a human-centered and multi-disciplinary  research group focusing on the relationship between the science and practice of design, and the digital technology that fuels intelligent products, services, and systems.

We are currently searching for a post-doctoral researcher. The post doc will operate in a national consortium with 10 partners that has the objective to develop a new Critical Resource Planning for ICT tool that will help businesses in their purchase, maintenance, and repair decisions to adopt more circular ICT solutions and to change their behaviors into more sustainable behaviors. The consortium will develop a prototype for this tool: RePlanIT. 

In this project, the post doc will be responsible to develop and validate a prototype of a scalable and dynamic circular product passport and a circular resource planner for ICT hardware, using laptops and data servers as the case. The passport should store information for ICT decision-makers, both about the delivered product (static) and about performance during the use phase (dynamic), which is important for maintenance, reuse, refurbishment, and replacement of the product in relation to the required functionalities of and compatibility within the entire IT system in which the hardware runs. The resource planner aims to make the data from the product passport transparent for ICT service providers (suppliers and/or internal service providers) and refurbishers. This system should enable to report and manage on circular KPIs by (a) predicting the necessity and timing of maintenance (condition-based maintenance), refurbishment and upgrading of the ICT hardware at product level; (b) determine the remaining service life of specific components in case of refurbishment, and (c) develop (phased) circular design and replacement strategies at system level.

The post doc will be part of the Circular Design lab within the faculty. This virtual lab brings together students and researchers with an interest in circular economy. Further, the post doc  will be part of AMS Research Fellow community, specifically the Circularity in Urban Regions program.

We are looking for a candidate with a PhD in design, sustainability/industrial ecology, or computer science/data management, who has a strong interest in studying the intersections between sustainability/circular economy, design tools and circular decision-making. In addition to the research, the post doc will be actively involved in teaching at the Industrial Design Engineering faculty (teaching load of 20%).

hits.title: PhD position funerary customs in the Roman Near East(1.0 FTE)
hits.job_description:
Applications are invited for a fully funded, four-year PhD position within the research project “Mortuary Archaeology of the Roman East - MARE”, financed by the Dutch Research Council (NWO) and led by the PI, Dr Lidewijde de Jong.

During the first centuries CE, new forms of funerary display emerged in the cemeteries of the Roman Near East. Memories of the deceased were prolonged after death through portraits and epitaphs, monumental stone coffins, and roadside tombs. This project investigates how these forms of displaying the dead were embedded in mortuary rituals. Bringing legacy dataset anddigital archives together, we interrogate how local communities reformulated their relationships with the dead by personalizing the funerary spaces.

In collaboration with the other team members, you will work on your own project Rituals in Space: reconstructing funerary rituals through gifts and bones. This PhD project focuses on the activities that occurred in the space of the tomb, from the first burial and post-burial actions, to its closure or abandonment. Through the analysis of the spatial setting, grave gifts, and human remains, the different steps in funerary rituals are reconstructed. This will give insights into the shared beliefs that the communities drew on in the care for the dead. This research builds a framework in which the fragmented materials of the Roman Near East can be inserted. It addresses the project’s main question by outlining how people interacted with the dead through ritual actions, and the extent to which the new tomb elements altered these practices. The sample comes from Coastal Lebanon and Pisidia (Turkey) and consist of legacy and new data on the spatial setting of human remains, coffins, epitaphs, and gravegoods.

An outline of the complete project is available at: https://www.rug.nl/research/groningen-institute-of-archaeology/research/mare/

This PhD project offers a unique opportunity to work in an international research environment as well as to acquire valuable teaching experience: the PhD candidate is expected to conduct 0.3 fte teaching during the second, third and fourth year of their appointment (0.1 fte yearly).

You will be asked to:

• complete a dissertation on funerary customs in Roman Lebanon and Pisidia
• collect legacy and new data together with the principal investigator and other team members
• assist other team members in developing the archaeological and spatial components of the project’s digital database
• co-organize research meetings and an online exhibit
• contribute to the project’s public outreach and social media activities
• participate in GIA, ARCHON, and other related events
• conduct a limited amount of teaching.

Jij doet dit in co-creatie met het werkveld en onderwijs.

Mooi werk
Wij zijn op zoek naar twee onderzoekers AI in het veiligheidsdomein. Ben jij er één van?

Als ervaren onderzoeker weet je veel over onderzoek in jouw expertisedomein en wil je deze kennis graag delen met het onderwijs en het werkveld. Vanuit je inhoudelijke en methodologische expertise ben je sparringpartner voor de lectoren binnen het Avans-zwaartepunt Veilig en Veerkrachtige Stad en Omgeving. Jij zet samen met hen onderzoeksprojecten op en ontwikkelt het zwaartepunt zelf door. Als verbinder betrek je daar het werkveld, docenten en studenten bij en stimuleer je de samenwerking met onderzoekers van andere projecten. Net zo gemakkelijk zet je jouw netwerk in of zoek je naar mogelijkheden om je netwerk verder uit te breiden. Jij rust niet voordat de resultaten van je onderzoek zijn verwerkt in het onderwijs en in toepassingen voor het werkveld. Je deelt de ontwikkelde kennis graag met de wetenschap.

Ook de bedrijfsvoeringskant van de projecten behoort tot je taken, inclusief de verantwoording aan opdrachtgever of subsidieverstrekker. Dankzij de kwaliteit van je werk, volgen extern gefinancierde vervolgprojecten (bijna) als vanzelf.

Gezien de samenstelling van het team zoeken wij specifiek twee nieuwe collega’s met twee specifieke kennis en ervaring: één voor de expertise over ethiek in relatie tot AI voor sociale en fysieke veiligheid in de stedelijke omgeving en één de expertise die zich toespitst op het vergroten van de handelingsperspectieven van professionals in het veiligheidsdomein voor het toepassen van AI in hun eigen werk en dat van burgercollectieven.

hits.job_description:
Are you highly motivated to understand communication in an increasingly digital society and advance the use of computational social sciences? Are you focused on addressing social challenges in dynamic and polarized media environments? Are you interested in communication with a focus on life science?

The Strategic Communication (COM) group is looking for a hardworking and ambitious assistant/associate professor in Communication science with a focus on or interest in life science. In this position, you are responsible for the coordination, organization, and implementation of new research activities on the application of innovative approaches of computational social sciences in communication research. We expect you to generate external financial support for an innovative research agenda. You are interested in (global) challenges in life science domains (e.g., health, climate change, and sustainable consumption). As our new colleague, you will critically explore and contribute to the understanding of how data-driven approaches in digital communication contexts can impact and contribute to broader individual and collective shifts in these life science domains. This includes, but is not limited to:
  • studying communication in online media, especially with regard to understanding digital communication mechanisms, processes of polarization and/or the presence and effects of mis- and disinformation;

hits.title: Technician in advanced in vitro bone modelling (1.0 FTE)
hits.job_description:
As a Technician in the Division of Pharmacology in the Utrecht Institute for Pharmaceutical Sciences, you will be responsible for the development of a 3D in vitro model of bone disease. Osteocytes, the major cells residing in bone, govern the rate at which old bone breaks down and new bone is being built. In certain diseases, such as chronic kidney disease (CKD), bone activity is disturbed, resulting in weak and brittle bones. However, little is known on why and how osteocytes are affected by the disease. In this project we aim to develop an in vitro model of osteocytes activity in CKD-specific conditions to better understand the biomolecular changes inflicted by the disease. The project involves the use of stem cells, cultured in 3D hydrogels that will be differentiated into osteocytes. Using biomolecular analysis (qPCR, ELISA, immunostainings) and mechanical testing (DMA), you will evaluate the activity of the osteocytes, cultured in healthy and diseased (plasma from CKD patients) conditions.

We believe this model will provide insights in osteocytes biology in CKD and will aid in the development of potential therapeutic targets. You will also evaluate the effect of emerging therapies on rescuing the cells from injury. The knowledge that we will acquire within this project will be at the base of several grant applications and collaborations with nephrologists and biomaterials engineers. This position is partially funded by NWO-XS (package 21-4).

The objectives for this position are:

  • establish the 3D cultures of osteocytes (from stem cells and commercial cell line);
  • analyse the biomolecular signature of differentiated osteocytes (under exposure to uremic stimuli);
  • evaluate bone formation (matrix and mineralization).


Additionally, you will be integrated within the technical cluster and provide support in the cell culture facility.

hits.title: Assistant Professor in Aesthetics with focus on Critical Race/Decolonial Theory and Film
hits.job_description:
What are you going to do

You will provide education in a dynamic context with ample opportunities for the development of innovative teaching methods. Your research will be part of the Amsterdam School for Cultural Analysis (ASCA), one of the five research schools of the Amsterdam Institute for Humanities Research. ASCA is home to more than 100 researchers and more than 140 PhD candidates, and conducts world-leading research in Cultural Analysis. ASCA members share a commitment to studying culture in all its forms and expressions within an interdisciplinary framework, and to maintaining a close connection with contemporary cultural and political debates. All ASCA research fits into at least one, but usually more than one of five thematic constellations: 1) Mediality; 2) Arts & Aesthetics; 3) Globalization & Migration; 4) Identities; and 5) Cultural & Social Critique. Across these constellations, ASCA is seeking to build expertise on Global South cultures and critical race and decolonial theory.

The position will be embedded within the department of Philosophy in the capacity group ‘Critical Cultural Theory’ (CCT). This capacity group investigates art, cultural production/analysis, and aesthetics as forms of critique, specific experiences of modernity and “ways of worldmaking.” The position will be shared with the Media Studies department of the Faculty of Humanities, which offers both depth and diversity in its approaches to the study of media, with a wide range of academic offerings and research interests. It is the largest department of Media Studies in the Netherlands and is consistently highly ranked in international rankings. Our fields of expertise include Film studies, Cross-media culture, New Media and Digital Culture, Information studies, Digital humanities, Journalism, Archival Studies, Globalisation Studies, and Digital Heritage.

Tasks and responsibilities:

  • designing and conducting independent research on aesthetics, critical race/decolonial theory and, ideally, film-philosophy, resulting in academic publications in peer-reviewed international journals and/or books;
  • actively pursuing external funding for research, notably funding from research councils, national as well as European;
  • actively contributing to and developing national and international research networks and other forms of cooperation;
  • actively contributing to the interdisciplinary research activities of ASCA;
  • developing, coordinating and teaching courses in both Dutch and English, in the Bachelor and Master programmes;
  • supervising Bachelor and Master theses and tutoring students; co-supervising PhD theses;
  • actively contributing to the development and improvement of the broader teaching programmes in the department;
  • taking part in committees and working groups, and carrying out departmental administrative tasks as directed.
hits.requirements_description:

What do we require

Your research will be in contemporary aesthetics. We are looking for a dynamic teacher/scholar who couples an engagement with media, arts, and cultures in different traditions with competencies in critical philosophy of race and post- or decolonial theory. The candidate should be interested in teaching students of philosophy as well as students in film and media studies. The position will be a joint appointment in the departments of philosophy and media studies.

You are able to develop and teach modules on aesthetics, critical race/decolonial theory, and film-philosophy. Important is proven flexibility in teaching on topics beyond your own research focus, a willingness to work in interdisciplinary teams of teachers and the ability to offer inspiring lectures and tutorials in the BA, MA and minor programmes that aspire to a wide range of students.

Your experience and profile:

  • holds a PhD in Philosophy, Cultural Theory, or a related field, with a research focus in Aesthetics and Critical Race or Decolonial Theory and an interest in Film-Philosophy. A strong background in 20th and 21st Century Philosophy is expected.
  • holds an international academic network in the research area concerned;
  • provides research output commensurate with the level of the position;
  • active and ambitious researcher with a strong publication record;
  • demonstrable ability and ambition to obtain external research grants;
  • broad and relevant teaching experience at BA and MA level;

hits.title: Postdoc 'Normative modelling of the human visual system'
hits.job_description:
We have a vacancy for an excellent post-doctoral research associate to work on a project focusing on the development and application of advanced methods for the analysis of the human visual system based on clinical neuroimaging data. The project is hosted by the Donders Institute for Brain, Cognition and Behavior at the Radboud University Medical Center (Cognitive Neuroscience department) under the supervision of Dr. Koen Haak and integrated into the wider academic research environment at the Donders Institute.

The focus of this project is to develop normative models of various functional and structural magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) measures of the human visual system based on existing large-scale neuroimaging datasets, and apply these (in collaboration with the department of ophthalmology) to better understand an individual's neural response to vision loss (e.g. neural plasticity, neural degeneration) and how this response might explain individual differences in functional vision in daily life activities. You will employ a range of MRI data-analysis techniques (structural and functional connectivity modeling, brain morphometry) including established and advanced approaches (e.g. connectivity gradient modeling, connective field modeling) and implement a software platform to enable other researchers and clinicians to take advantage of the innovations produced in this project.

Tasks and responsibilities
  • Discuss, plan and perform research in a stimulating environment.
  • Develop normative models of the human visual system using large-scale MRI datasets.
  • Apply these normative models to understand neural responses to vision loss.
  • Publish findings in peer-reviewed journals and present at international scientific conferences.
  • Produce software tools to enable for the use of the wider scientific community.
  • Assist with the supervision of students and more junior staff.
  • Work in an interdisciplinary team of international scientists.
