hits.title: Postdoc researcher on theory and quantitative economic modelling for a circular economy
hits.job_description:
The postdoctoral researcher/teacher will work on the Horizon Europe project “CircoMod - Circular economy modelling for climate change mitigation”. Its aim is to model how circular economy (CE) strategies impact GHG emissions and resource efficiency. The researcher will contribute to the project by extending existing economic theories and models with circular economy features. Extensions include the representation of secondary markets and material balances, including a vintage structure in the resource use block, and linking material physical flows to trade patterns, sector value-added, primary and secondary material use, regional competitiveness, and resource (in)dependence. Through the project the researcher collaborates with a diverse group of European researchers on economics, climate, material flows, and policy making.

 

The new researcher will work with prof. Reyer Gerlagh on the economic modelling activities and with Dr Asel Doranova on policy dialogues and work with stakeholders. The project is expected to lead to publications in top field journals.

 

The job includes a 25% teaching task consisting of thesis supervision and teaching in Python-related programming courses and environmental economics courses.

hits.title: Postdoc to study sex differences in adipose tissue function
hits.job_description: We are seeking a highly motivated postdoc with experience in working with induced pluripotent stem (iPS) cells to join our research group. The project is aimed at unraveling how chromosomal sex and hormonal influences regulate sex differences in adipose tissue function. Sex-specific cell lines for white and brown adipocytes are currently a limiting factor. In this project, you will develop novel adipocyte models using patient-derived iPS cells to study sex differences in adipose tissue function. You will use your knowledge and experience in stem cell biology, cell model development, and gene editing technology to generate models for several human diseases of metabolic disorders, including genetic obesity, polycystic ovary syndrome, and disorders of sex differentiation.

hits.title: Medewerker Website Support, Analytics en Testing
hits.job_description:
Onze website tilburguniversity.edu wordt gemiddeld 18.000 keer per dag bezocht. Bezoekers vinden er alle informatie over onze opleidingen, onderzoek en als platform voor alle diensten voor studenten en medewerkers. De website is dus gericht op al onze doelgroepen en meer dan 400 medewerkers dragen eraan bij met informatie. Als team Web & Marketing Technology hebben we dus contacten binnen de hele universiteit. Daarnaast werken we nauw samen met de andere teams van de divisie Marketing & Communication (M&C): External & Campus Communicatie, Marketing, Alumni relaties en Studium Generale.

 

Jouw functie

Je krijgt een afwisselend takenpakket met taken op het gebied van functioneel beheer en op het gebied van analytics. Je taken zijn o.a.: 

  • Afhandeling van gebruikersvragen over de website, het Content Management Systeem, Google Analytics, en andere aanverwante applicaties.
  • Afhandeling van storingen: je checkt de website op broken links, als er ‘bugs’ worden gemeld probeer je te achterhalen wat de oorzaak kan zijn en meld je dat bij onze applicatiebeheerder. 
  • Je werkt mee aan de productie van webformulieren, het beheren van trefwoordenlijsten en het autoriseren van gebruikers 
  • Testen: bij het voorbereiden en opleveren van wijzigingen in het Content Management Systeem, test je of alles naar behoren werkt.

In deze functie werk je vooral samen met andere teamleden die functioneel beheer in hun takenpakket hebben, met onze front office en met de adviseur online communicatie.

hits.title: Promovendus / PhD Candidate
hits.job_description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een gedreven en enthousiaste promovendus voor onderzoek naar de effectiviteit van een nieuwe interventie voor ouders van kinderen met gedragsproblemen voor 28,8 uur per week (0,8 FTE), gedurende 5 jaar.

Wat houdt de functie in?
Je doet door middel van een gerandomiseerde gecontroleerde trial onderzoek naar de (kosten)effectiviteit van een korte, flexibele training-op-maat voor ouders van kinderen met gedragsproblemen, met eventuele vervolgbehandeling om terugval te voorkomen. Het onderzoek maakt deel uit van de PAINT-studies (zie www.paint-studies.nl), waarin nauw wordt samengewerkt met de Vrije Universiteit, de Universiteit van Amsterdam en de KU Leuven. De oudertraining is ontwikkeld op basis van eerdere resultaten van de PAINT-studies. De training zal aan ouders worden gegeven door behandelaren in verschillende Nederlandse instellingen voor jeugd-GGZ.

Je voornaamste taken en verantwoordelijkheden zijn:

  • Je bent (samen met een team van begeleiders) verantwoordelijk voor de inhoudelijke, organisatorische en logistieke aspecten van het onderzoeksproject;
  • Je neemt deel aan het trainingsprogramma voor PhD kandidaten van de Research School of Behavioural and Cognitive Neurosciences (BCN) Groningen; 
  • Je rapporteert de onderzoeksbevindingen in publicaties in internationale vaktijdschriften en rondt het project af met een proefschrift;
  • Je verspreidt vergaarde kennis binnen Nederland en op internationale congressen.

hits.title: HR-medewerker
hits.job_description:
Haal jij energie uit het beantwoorden van alle soorten HR-vragen van collega's? Ondersteun je graag in het HR-proces en heb je administratief altijd alles tot in de puntjes verzorgd? Dan ben jij nodig!

Als HR-medewerker ben je het eerste belangrijke aanspreekpunt voor medewerkers bij vragen over arbeidsvoorwaarden, regelingen en procedures en ben je verantwoordelijk voor de personeelsadministratie. Je hebt in deze rol dagelijks contact met leidinggevenden en medewerkers over HR-gerelateerde zaken en bent daardoor goed op de hoogte van wat er binnen de docentenacademie speelt. Je voorziet hen van informatie en adviseert over het gebruik van bestaande, actuele HR-regelingen en -procedures.

In de rol van HR-medewerker ben je verantwoordelijk voor het registreren, actualiseren en beheren van personeelsgegevens in het personeelsinformatiesysteem (BASS HRM/Oracle). Accuratesse zit jou dan ook in het bloed en je krijgt energie van het zorgen voor een up-to-date administratie.

Je verzorgt de correspondentie en informatie rond in, door- en uitstroom en zorgt voor managementinformatie rond verzuim en verlof. In jouw rol bewaak je afspraken en termijnen van contracten en ben je betrokken bij de uitvoering van het verzuimbeleid. Ook adviseer je over de primaire arbeidsvoorwaarden en voer je arbeidsvoorwaardengesprekken. Tenslotte doe je voorstellen rond verbetering van werkprocessen en procedures.

hits.title: Tenure track faculty position in experimental quantum matter and optics
hits.location: Anna van Buerenplein, 2595 DE, Den Haag
hits.job_description:
The Faculty of Science and the Leiden Institute of Physics invite applications for a Tenure track faculty position in experimental quantum matter and optics

Vacancy number 22-092

The Leiden Institute of Physics (LION) offers a faculty position in experimental quantum matter and optics, with a research emphasis on electronic properties of matter. The successful candidate will have the freedom to develop an independent research program in this field, connecting to and expanding on existing research at LION. Our own research in this area focuses on (engineered) quantum materials, with quantum optics and photon-matter interactions as adjacent fields of interest, while reaching out to the interface between physics and chemistry. A new research group is starting up shortly, focusing on van der Waals materials.

Our new colleague will have full access to the joint infrastructure, which includes extensive thin film preparation, nanolithography (including EBPG and FIB), magnetotransport facilities below 1 K, and microscopy techniques such as low-temperature STM, LEEM, AFM, break junctions, and various single-molecule fluorescence techniques. Vice versa, we expect our new staff member to contribute to an open academic atmosphere in which discussion and collegiality are held high.

Appointments at associate or full professor level may be considered for truly outstanding candidates.

Key responsibilities

•Establishing an independent, internationally recognized research line, with publications in leading scientific journals;

• Successful acquisition of external funds through research grants;

• Teaching at the undergraduate and graduate level in physics;

• Supervision of BSc and MSc students in their research projects;

• Contribution to the management and organization of the institute;

• Co-responsibility for a collegial atmosphere in which high-level science can thrive.
hits.requirements_description:
Requirements

Selection criteria

• PhD degree in physics and research experience at the postdoctoral level;

• Strong interest in an academic career as evidenced through activities and publication record;

• A research plan that connects to current research at LION;

• Excellent communications skills in English, both written and verbal;

• Strong commitment to teaching and willingness to further develop teaching skills.

The salary ranges between € 3.821,- and € 5.230,- gross per month (pay scale 11 in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities). In exceptional cases, candidates at the associate or full professor level will be taken into consideration.

hits.employer_description:
Employer

Information Tenure Track

We offer a tenure track that upon successful performance will lead to a tenured position as associate professor, and upon continued growth to promotion to a full professor position. At the end of the tenure track, a reasonable proficiency in the Dutch language is expected. We offer a competitive start-up package, a clear and inviting career path, a supportive and collegial academic atmosphere and support in the development of your personal and professional skills, for example through coaching and training. A special mentoring program is offered with fellow Tenure Trackers in a peer group as well as with senior staff members in the department.

Our organisation

The QMO-section in Leiden consists of a number of experimental groups in Quantum Matter and Quantum Optics, as well as several theory groups working in Quantum Matter and Quantum. For more information, see the website.

We are embedded in the Leiden Institute of Physics, with its long-standing tradition of excellence in physics research. Apart from the above-mentioned state-of-the-art preparation and measurement facilities, low-vibration space will be available in our ultramicroscopy hall, and LION experimental groups are (at no costs) supported by excellent mechanical and electronic workshops. We foster an international and collaborative atmosphere and have close ties to especially the TU Delft, through our joint Casimir Research School, as well as to the University of Amsterdam, SRON, and many institutes abroad.

The Faculty of Science is a world-class faculty where staff and students work together in a dynamic international environment. It is a faculty where personal and academic development are top priorities. We are committed to expand fundamental knowledge by curiosity and to look beyond the borders of their own discipline; aiming to benefit science, and to make a contribution to addressing the major societal challenges of the future.

The research carried out at the Faculty of Science is very diverse, ranging from mathematics, information science, astronomy, physics, chemistry and bio-pharmaceutical sciences to biology and environmental sciences. The research activities are organised in eight institutes. These institutes offer eight bachelor’s and twelve master’s programmes. The faculty has grown strongly in recent years and now has more than 2,300 staff and almost 5,000 students. We are located at the heart of Leiden’s Bio Science Park, one of Europe’s biggest science parks, where university and business life come together. For more information, see https://www.universiteitleiden.nl/en/science and https://workingat.leiden.edu/.

hits.job_description:
Applications are invited for a fully funded, four-year PhD position within the research project “Mortuary Archaeology of the Roman East - MARE”, financed by the Dutch Research Council (NWO) and led by the PI, dr. Lidewijde de Jong.

During the first centuries CE, new forms of funerary display emerged in the cemeteries of the Roman Near East. Memories of the deceased were prolonged after death through portraits and epitaphs, monumental stone coffins, and roadside tombs. This project investigates how these forms of displaying the dead were embedded in mortuary rituals. Bringing legacy dataset anddigital archives together, we interrogate how local communities reformulated their relationships with the dead by personalizing the funerary spaces.

In collaboration with the other team members, you will work on your own project Encoffined Bodies: decorated sarcophagi in funerary customs in Coastal Lebanon. Burial in stone coffins, many decorated in relief, was a popular practice in the Near East under Roman rule. Being part of a funerary context, the coffins played a role in the proper care for and remembrance of the deceased. As a container for the corpse - simultaneously protecting the body and hiding its disintegration- it speaks directly to concepts of the body held by the burying community, and to the role of the materiality of the coffin and its decoration in the care for the dead. This PhD project investigates the ritual function of sarcophagi in their material, epigraphic, and pictorial setting. The research concentrates on the coast of Lebanon, which had a long history of use of coffin burials. Legacy collections from older excavations and epigraphic or art historical surveys form the core dataset. Contextual data comes from recent rescue excavations, such as those in Beirut.

An outline of the complete project is available at: https://www.rug.nl/research/groningen-institute-of-archaeology/research/mare/

This PhD project offers a unique opportunity to work in an international research environment as well as to acquire valuable teaching experience: the PhD candidate is expected to conduct 0.3 fte teaching during the second, third and fourth year of their appointment (0.1 fte yearly).

You will be asked to:

• complete a dissertation on the ritual function of sarcophagi in Roman Lebanon
• collect legacy and new data together with the principal investigator and other team members
• assist other team members in developing the visual/iconographic components of the project’s digital database
• co-organize research meetings and an online exhibit
• contribute to the project’s public outreach and social media activities

Applications are invited for a fully funded, four-year PhD position within the research project “Mortuary Archaeology of the Roman East - MARE”, financed by the Dutch Research Council (NWO) and led by the PI, Dr Lidewijde de Jong.

During the first centuries CE, new forms of funerary display emerged in the cemeteries of the Roman Near East. Memories of the deceased were prolonged after death through portraits and epitaphs, monumental stone coffins, and roadside tombs. This project investigates how these forms of displaying the dead were embedded in mortuary rituals. Bringing legacy dataset anddigital archives together, we interrogate how local communities reformulated their relationships with the dead by personalizing the funerary spaces.

In collaboration with the other team members, you will work on your own project Rituals in Space: reconstructing funerary rituals through gifts and bones. This PhD project focuses on the activities that occurred in the space of the tomb, from the first burial and post-burial actions, to its closure or abandonment. Through the analysis of the spatial setting, grave gifts, and human remains, the different steps in funerary rituals are reconstructed. This will give insights into the shared beliefs that the communities drew on in the care for the dead. This research builds a framework in which the fragmented materials of the Roman Near East can be inserted. It addresses the project’s main question by outlining how people interacted with the dead through ritual actions, and the extent to which the new tomb elements altered these practices. The sample comes from Coastal Lebanon and Pisidia (Turkey) and consist of legacy and new data on the spatial setting of human remains, coffins, epitaphs, and gravegoods.

An outline of the complete project is available at: https://www.rug.nl/research/groningen-institute-of-archaeology/research/mare/

hits.title: Lector Ondermijning
hits.job_description:
U stelt een onderzoeksplan op, werft opdrachten, onderhoudt contacten met de beroepspraktijk en wetenschap en begeleidt docenten en studenten in hun ontwikkeling.

Mooi werk
U werkt voor een vernieuwd lectoraat van het oude Expertisecentrum Veiligheid (EV). U wilt binnen dit thema kennis ontwikkelen door het (laten) verrichten van praktijkgericht onderzoek, waarbij u ervoor zorgt dat de inhoudelijke en methodologische kwaliteit van het onderzoek goed is en de wisselwerking tussen onderzoek, onderwijs en werkveld optimaal. Dit doet u door kenniskringen met docent-onderzoekers in te richten en hen te coachen. Door studenten en professionals een leeromgeving aan te bieden. En door in- en extern op te treden als expert en kwaliteitsdrager van allerlei onderzoeksgerelateerde zaken. U werft extern gefinancierde projecten die passen in de context van het onderwijs en het onderzoeksthema.

De kern van het onderzoek van het lectoraat is het inzichtelijk maken hoe processen en mechanismen van ondermijning werken, welke rol burgers, professionals en hun organisaties daarbij spelen en hoe deze weerbaarder gemaakt kunnen worden tegen deze ontwikkelingen. Ondermijning wordt gedefinieerd als de ontwrichting van maatschappelijke structuren en fundamenten en aantasting van de rechtstaat, door verwevenheid van onderwereld en bovenwereld, als gevolg van of verbonden met georganiseerde criminaliteit. Ondermijnende criminaliteit is vooral een economisch gedreven maatschappelijk fenomeen.

Bij de aanpak van ondermijnende criminaliteit zijn veel partijen betrokken op verschillende niveaus. De insteek van de aanpak is al even divers en hangt samen met de variëteit aan partijen. Belangrijke spelers zijn de opsporingsdiensten en het openbaar ministerie, de belastingdienst en lokale overheden, maar ook professionals in het sociaal domein, de zorg en bijvoorbeeld woningcorporaties. Elk van de betrokken partijen heeft zijn eigen instrumentarium, gekoppeld aan bevoegdheden en expertise. De sleutel tot een effectieve aanpak ligt in samenwerking tussen partijen en de uitwisseling van informatie en expertise.

En hierin ligt dan ook de kern van de onderzoeksopgave van dit lectoraat:

  • Het vergroten van de weerbaarheid van professionals, dienstverleners en branches. Door zelf weerbaar te zijn tegen directe ondermijnende activiteiten, maar ook door het signaleren van ondermijnende activiteiten en hiertegen in actie te komen
  • Het vergroten van de weerbaarheid van burgers: welke factoren stimuleren en belemmeren de meldingsbereidheid aan de overheid en hoe zijn deze te beïnvloeden.
  • Het versterken van de samenwerking tussen betrokken organisaties voor het creëren van meer impact dan alleen voldoen aan de eisen van ieders eigen organisatie: hoe om te gaan met de effectiviteit van het instrumentarium van elke partner t.o.v. elkaar? Hoe te komen tot ‘ons’ instrumentarium? Wat vereist dat van de professionals en de organisaties van de toekomst?

In de eerste termijn van het lectoraat zijn drie onderzoekslijnen ontwikkeld, samen met de beroepspraktijk en het onderwijs: Indicatoren ten behoeve van vroegsignalering van ondermijning met gebruik van data, Weerbaarheid van het openbaar bestuur en Burgerparticipatie.

Voor de komende lectoraatsperiode is met de stakeholders nagegaan waar de grootste kennisbehoefte uit bestaat: de huidige thema’s zijn nog steeds actueel. Daarnaast blijkt er behoefte aan een meer systeemgerichte benadering van het thema ondermijning, is er ruimte voor de bestudering van fysieke aspecten van ondermijning en is verdergaande aansluiting bij de nationale en internationale beleidsagenda’s gewenst, waarbij de huidige en nieuw op te zetten onderzoekslijnen worden geïntegreerd.

hits.title: Opleidingsmanager Accountancy
hits.employer: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht
hits.job_description:
Heb jij visie op het financiële werkveld én affiniteit met het onderwijs? Ben je werkzaam of werkzaam geweest in de financiële wereld of heb je kennis van actuele ontwikkelingen? Heb je het vermogen om een team aan je te binden en weet je zowel studenten als docenten te inspireren? 
Dan gaan we graag met je in gesprek!

Instituut Finance & Accounting is volop in beweging. Samen met het bedrijfsleven werken we aan actuele vraagstukken. Binnen de HU werken we samen met andere instituten en Kenniscentra vanuit een multidisciplinaire benadering van onderwijs en onderzoek. In die ontwikkelingen staat het docententeam centraal. Om die ontwikkelingen mee vorm te geven zijn we op zoek naar versterking van ons managementteam en zoeken we een enthousiaste en ambitieuze opleidingsmanager. Als mensgerichte opleidingsmanager ben je in staat om complexe veranderingsprocessen aan te sturen en ben je (mede) verantwoordelijk voor de totstandbrenging en uitvoering van het jaarplan van het instituut. Meer info zie hier de link.

Wat ga je doen?
Als Opleidingsmanager ben je verantwoordelijk voor de opleiding Accountancy binnen het instituut en voor een team van docenten. Daarnaast ben je verantwoordelijk voor onderdelen van het generieke curriculum en voor een aantal instituut-brede portefeuilles, afhankelijk van jouw profiel en ambities, maar in ieder geval voor de portefeuille onderwijslogistiek. Je levert bijdragen aan het algemeen beleid van het instituut, de ontwikkeling en inrichting van het assortiment en de ontwikkeling, inrichting en uitvoering van het onderwijs. Van de Opleidingsmanager wordt verwacht dat deze proactief, zelfstandig en in samenwerking met de collega’s sturing geeft aan de kwaliteit, het rendement, de onderwijsvernieuwing, de versterking van onderzoek en de binding met het werkveld. De Opleidingsmanagers en de Instituutsdirecteur vormen het managementteam van het instituut (MT).

hits.title: Onderzoeker AI in het veiligheidsdomein
hits.job_description:
Jij doet dit in co-creatie met het werkveld en onderwijs.

Mooi werk
Wij zijn op zoek naar twee onderzoekers AI in het veiligheidsdomein. Ben jij er één van?

Als ervaren onderzoeker weet je veel over onderzoek in jouw expertisedomein en wil je deze kennis graag delen met het onderwijs en het werkveld. Vanuit je inhoudelijke en methodologische expertise ben je sparringpartner voor de lectoren binnen het Avans-zwaartepunt Veilig en Veerkrachtige Stad en Omgeving. Jij zet samen met hen onderzoeksprojecten op en ontwikkelt het zwaartepunt zelf door. Als verbinder betrek je daar het werkveld, docenten en studenten bij en stimuleer je de samenwerking met onderzoekers van andere projecten. Net zo gemakkelijk zet je jouw netwerk in of zoek je naar mogelijkheden om je netwerk verder uit te breiden. Jij rust niet voordat de resultaten van je onderzoek zijn verwerkt in het onderwijs en in toepassingen voor het werkveld. Je deelt de ontwikkelde kennis graag met de wetenschap.

Ook de bedrijfsvoeringskant van de projecten behoort tot je taken, inclusief de verantwoording aan opdrachtgever of subsidieverstrekker. Dankzij de kwaliteit van je werk, volgen extern gefinancierde vervolgprojecten (bijna) als vanzelf.

Gezien de samenstelling van het team zoeken wij specifiek twee nieuwe collega’s met twee specifieke kennis en ervaring: één voor de expertise over ethiek in relatie tot AI voor sociale en fysieke veiligheid in de stedelijke omgeving en één de expertise die zich toespitst op het vergroten van de handelingsperspectieven van professionals in het veiligheidsdomein voor het toepassen van AI in hun eigen werk en dat van burgercollectieven.

hits.title: Onderwijscoördinator HTRIC (0,6 fte)
hits.job_description:
Health Technology Research and Innovation Cluster; We are HTRIC

Health Technology and Innovation Cluster (HTRIC) is een gezamenlijk initiatief van de Rijksuniversiteit Groningen en het UMCG, samen met onder andere De Hanzehogeschool, NHL Stenden en het Life Cooperative. HTRIC verbindt onderzoek, gezondheidstechnologie en klinische praktijk voor meer gezonde jaren.
Om onze ambitie “gezondheidstechnologie voor meer gezonde jaren” waar te maken zijn wij op zoek naar een energieke en verbindende onderwijscoördinator.
In de rol van onderwijscoördinator ben je verantwoordelijk om de ambitieuze doelstelling van HTRIC te vertalen naar concrete onderwijsprogramma’s. Centraal hierbij staat de methodiek design thinking die in alle programma’s de basis moet vormen. Je verbindt hierbij het interne netwerk van kennispartners onderling en aan dat van onze bedrijfspartners. Aan de kennisinhoudelijke collega’s voeg je organisatiekracht toe en voer je strakke regie als het om planning en rolverdeling gaat. Door jouw enthousiasme en inzet leveren netwerkpartners graag hun bijdrage.

● Je bent het eerste aanspreekpunt voor HTRIC op het gebied van onderwijs.
● Je weet bij al onze kennispartners inhoudelijke experts te vinden en binden aan HTRIC.
● Je houdt je bezig met het programmatisch uitwerken van het onderwijs van HTRIC waarbij de “Design thinking course voor PhD” (zie bijlage 1) het startpunt vormt.
● Je draagt zorg voor gestructureerde realisatie van de samenwerking met business partners.
● Je helpt inzichtelijk maken welke behoeftes bedrijfspartners in Noord Nederland hebben op het gebied van young human capital in het kader van health technology en helpt dit vorm te geven in (aanvullende) onderwijsprogramma’s.

hits.title: Assistant Professor in Computational Law (0.8-1.0 fte)
hits.job_description:
You will be offered the opportunity to collaborate with data scientists and legal researchers, and to apply (and learn) data science methods and solutions in relation to the legal domain. The responsibilities are diverse. You will teach, conduct innovative and high-quality research, write research proposals, and participate in strategic and administrative activities. This set of responsibilities will, among other things, allow you to:

  • Grow in academia
  • Be a pioneer in the field of law and data science
  • Collaborate with experts from law as well as computer science
  • Perform individually and collaboratively
  • Build networks
  • Participate and lead projects
  • Pursue strategies to translate research results into innovation
  • Develop and advance courses and educational programs at the intersection of law and data science.

The application of computational methods in the legal domain will revolutionize legal academia and practice. There is a growing need to develop data infrastructures for the legal domain and to test methodologies for legal analysis in order to answer empirical research questions. This position helps address this need by contributing to cutting-edge research that applies data science and artificial intelligence to a legal or regulatory context.

We invite applications for a position at the Maastricht Law and Tech Lab, which closely collaborates with the Institute of Data Science and the Department of Knowledge Engineering at Maastricht University. It is an exciting and vibrant community where legal scholars and data scientists meet and form interdisciplinary teams that work at the intersection of Data Science and Law.
hits.requirements_description:
Requirements

Applicants should fulfill the following main requirements:

  • PhD degree in law, data science, artificial intelligence, computer science, mathematics, or a related field. Legal scholars with a doctrinal focus do not fit the profile;
  • Experience in applying data science (individually and/or jointly);
  • Excellence in research and, preferably, a track record of obtaining research funding;
  • Experience in teaching;
  • Experience in supervising Bachelor, Masters, or PhD students;
  • A personality characterized by vision, ambition, and collaboration;
  • Fluency in the English language.
  • (optional) Geek-friendly.
hits.conditions_description:
Conditions of employment

You will be employed temporarily for 12 or 18 months (depending on your employment history) as assistant professor (level 2) and will co-develop and agree to specific development goals. Towards the end of this contract period the decision will be taken on whether or not to grant an employment contract for an indefinite period. Your development goals will also allow you to grow further to the position of assistant professor (level 1).

The salary depends on academic qualifications and experience. The salary will be set between minimum gross month salary € 3,821 and maximum gross month salary of € 5,230 (according to assistant professor 2), based on a full-time employment, of the Collective Labour Agreement of the Dutch Universities. For people recruited from abroad a reduced income tax rate may apply. Maastricht University has attractive employment conditions, which include a pension scheme, holidays, holiday allowance and an end of year bonus.

The preferred starting date is in spring / summer 2022.

The terms of employment of Maastricht University are set out in the Collective Labour Agreement of Dutch Universities (CAO). Furthermore, local UM provisions also apply. For more information look at the website www.maastrichtuniversity.nl > About UM > Working at UM.
hits.employer_description:
Employer

Maastricht University

The Faculty of Law of Maastricht University provides challenging and high-quality legal education for Bachelor's and Master's students. The faculty is a pioneer in small-scale and innovative education and trains lawyers for both the national and international labor market. The faculty is in the top 3 of law schools in the EU and, with 51% foreign students, is the most international law faculty in Europe. It has 3000 students and more than 300 employees. Maastricht University provides you a unique international experience in a Dutch city.

The research within the faculty is conducted within one of the faculty research institutes and the Maastricht Graduate School of Law. The focus of the research is on European and international aspects of law, human rights, migration, and Law & Technology. The faculty attaches great importance to both fundamental and more practical research and is known for its stimulating research and education climate.

Maastricht University (UM) is the most international university in the Netherlands and is still growing with its more than 20,000 students and 4,700 employees. The university distinguishes itself through its innovative educational model, international character and multidisciplinary approach to research and education. Thanks to the high quality of its research and education, as well as a strong social orientation, the university has built a solid reputation in its short existence. It is considered one of the best young universities in the world. UM has six faculties: Faculty of Health, Medicine and Life Sciences, Faculty of Law, School of Business and Economics, Faculty of Science and Engineering, Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences and the Faculty of Psychology and Neuroscience.

Maastricht University aims to be and remain an attractive employer. It is convinced that it can achieve this by challenging and encouraging staff and students to get the best out of themselves. By employing those staff members for the activities in which they can do their best work. And by hiring and retaining employees who fit the profile and ambition of UM.

hits.title: Teamleider Student Administratie (0,8 - 1,0 fte)
hits.job_description:
Positionering van de functie
Het team Student Administratie inschrijf en volg bestaat uit 9 medewerkers, die samen verantwoordelijk zijn voor het in- en uitschrijven van studenten (inschrijf) en faciliteren van de studievoortgang (volg). Dit team vormt een onderdeel van de afdeling Student Administratie (SA), wat weer onderdeel van de divisie Academic Services (AS) en bestaat uit 58 medewerkers. Student Administration is verantwoordelijk voor de volgende zaken: 

  • het in- en uitschrijven van studenten;
  • de centrale registratie van de studieresultaten;
  • de diplomering van studenten;
  • het roosteren van de colleges en (her)tentamens;
  • de afname van de tentamens;
  • de eerstelijns vragen van studenten via de Student Desk.

 

Voor het team Student administratie “inschrijf en volg”, is per direct een vacature van één jaar (met uitzicht op verlenging) voor een Teamleider Student Administratie (0,8 – 1,0 fte). Wij zijn op zoek naar een young professional, die de mensen in het team begeleid in hun doorontwikkeling.

 

Het team bestaat uit een groep medewerkers, die sinds lange periode met elkaar samen werken en zelfstandig functioneren. Vanwege de Coronaperiode hebben de medewerkers de afgelopen jaren de aandacht gelegd op het uitvoeren van het reguliere werk. Hierdoor is minder tijd geweest voor verbeter- en verandertrajecten. De teamleider zal met name gevraagd worden om samen met het team de processen en werkinstructies te optimaliseren en veranderingen in o.a. implementeren van wijzigingen in applicaties, beleid en wetgeving in de dagelijkse werkzaamheden te realiseren. 

 

In de aard van de werkzaamheden van het team moet o.a. gedacht worden aan het in- en uitschrijfproces, inclusief collegegeld heffingen zo optimaal mogelijk te laten verlopen, het opvoeren van studieresultaten en vrijstellingen in Osiris, het ervoor zorgen dat de student een compleet overzicht heeft van zijn studievoortgang, het controleren van de studievoortgang van de bachelor en masterstudenten en als aan alle onderdelen van de opleiding is voldaan en het vervaardigen van diplomastukken.

 

Verantwoordelijkheden en taken teamleider 

  • Samen opstellen van een toekomstplan voor het team administratie en bijdragen aan de realisatie ervan
  • Uitvoeren van het HR beleid in het eigen team
  • Leiding en sturing geven aan medewerkers en werkzaamheden binnen het team i.s.m de coördinator van de medewerkers “volg” en de medewerkers “inschrijf”
  • Structureel overleg met afdelingshoofd Student Administration en de andere teamleiders van Student Administration;
  • Structureel overleg met teams zoals Informatie Management (functioneel beheer en consultants Osiris) en Finance Services en Controle over o.a. de openstaande issues en planning komende periode. 
  • Afhandelen van klachten van studenten en hierin adviseren van het afdelingshoofd;
  • Bijdrage leveren aan verbeter- en verandertrajecten in relatie tot inschrijving en volg (bijv. wijzigingen in toepassen van Osiris, verbetering van processen);
  • Bijdragen aan beleidsontwikkeling in relatie tot nieuwe wetgeving en meewerken aan de implementatie ervan

 

Er zijn diverse periodes in relatie tot inschrijving en diplomering per jaar en je bent bereid om je vakantie hierop aan te passen.

hits.title: PhD Long-term interactions between river dynamics, vegetation, groundwater, land-use, and animals in Bardia National Park, Nepal
hits.job_description:
Are you an environmental scientist with experience in field and laboratory methods and quantitative data analysis? Are you interested in wild life conservation and the Holocene evolution of river systems? Do you want to work in an interdisciplinary team of researchers, and with stakeholders under adventurous, sometimes challenging conditions in a stunning landscape in Asia? Then you could be the ideal PhD candidate to join our team!

We are hiring a PhD candidate for a 4-year project that aims to better understand the interaction between humans, animals, river-floodplain and mega fan dynamics. You will collide and collect palaeo-environmental data to shed light into the natural, pre-human river dynamics, and how humans have changed the rivers and alluvial fans in time. This information is crucial for landscape regeneration, and supports habitat restoration required for successful Tiger conservation. You will use a wide range of methods to gain quantitative understanding in past landscape functioning, including luminescence dating of fluvial deposits, vegetation reconstruction (based on palynology and ancient sedimentary DNA), remote sensing, and landscape reconstructions using state-of-the-art landscape evolution models.

This PhD position is part of the transdisciplinary research project Save the tiger, Save the grasslands, Save the water!, financed by the National Science Agenda program of the Dutch Research Council NWO, The project is a collaboration of 25 partners ranging from Dutch and Nepali universities, NGO's and companies, working in the field of hydrology, ecology, nature conservation and stakeholder participation and communication. The overall objective is to understand and model the spatio-temporal dynamics of the grasslands as crucial landscape elements for the tiger habitat in Nepalese and Indian nature reserves at the foot of the Himalayas.

You will be part of the Soil Geography & Landscape group of Wageningen University, and will join the PhD program of the PE&RC graduate school. This environment, in combination with the embedding in a large transdisciplinary project and co-creating knowledge with local stakeholders in Nepal, gives you all opportunities to develop new skills and kick-start your academic career.
Preferred starting date is June 1st 2022.

Are you aspired to change the way agri-food systems currently operate and want to contribute to the transition towards climate-smart agriculture? Have you envisioned an academic career thriving on close interactions with stakeholders? Are you interested in helping stakeholders to transform their business strategies, co-design alternative business models, and pursue systematic transition towards climate-smart production? Then we are looking for you!

The European BEATLES project connects 18 organizations and 5 use cases with the aim to develop transformative pathways to encourage transition to fair, healthy and environment-friendly food systems. The ideal candidate will contribute to BEATELS with identifying sets of business strategies for establishing roadmaps towards climate-smart agriculture. For the interdisciplinary European BEATLES project we are looking for a highly motivated PhD candidate with a background in strategy and innovation studies, particularly with a focus on business model innovation.

As a PhD candidate, you will:
  • Be part of the BEATLES consortium and will collaborate with diverse sets of companies and research institutes in addition to a team of researchers from Wageningen University and Wageningen Economic Research,
  • Work with five innovative use cases and their stakeholders that represent diverse food systems in transition to climate-smart agriculture,
  • Explore stakeholder needs to develop value propositions and strategies that establish fairness for all value chain actors,
  • Co-design alternative business models together with stakeholders by identifying changes that should be implemented for the transition towards climate-smart food systems,
  • Develop and validate a portfolio of innovative business models,
  • Participate and present your research findings at international conferences, and publish articles in academic journals
The research is embedded within the chair Business, Management and Organization (BMO - WUR), led by Prof. Wilfred Dolfsma and Wageningen Economic Research. You will be supervised by Dr. Maral Mahdad (Business, Management and Organization- BMO) and Dr. Gohar Isakhanyan (Wageningen Economic Research- WeCR).

hits.title: Quality Coordinator/ QA Officer
hits.job_description:

  • Keeping Up-to-date of all relevant procedures in the Quality Management System (QMS)
  • Organizing, conducting and or supporting internal and external audits and inspections
  • Reporting of deviations and Corrective And Preventive Actions (CAPA's)
  • Writing and maintenance of Standard Operating Procedures (SOP's) of the EUPG group.
  • Set up and maintenance of all quality related documentation.

Quality is of key importance at EUPG (‘’audit ready at all times’’). Projects are completed within the set timelines and budgets. These projects are financed from both public and private funds.

You report to one of the programme managers and you are responsible for the upkeep and maintenance of the Quality Management System (QMS). To this end you work closely with the clinical study teams of project managers, clinical trial assistants, scientists and data management employees.
hits.requirements_description:

You have a minimum experience as quality coordinator/QA officer within a clinical research setting. You know your way around an academic research organization and have experience in working with international organisations. Incidental travel within Europ is no problem. You have a sound knowledge of and experience with clinical research/studies, the ICH-GCP guidelines, the European Clinical Trial Regulation and national and international law applicable to clinical research. You are capable of setting up internal and external audits of international clinical research within an academic setting and from a sponsor role perspective. As quality coordinator/QA officer you have good oversight at all times. You conduct your work smart and effective, are skilled in communication to your colleagues and professionals and you are getting things done whilst keeping all parties on board. You are decisive, strong willed and when necessary can indicate clear boundaries. Because EUPG projects are focussed on studies in the area of infectious diseases it is a plus if you have affinity with this medical indication. Furthermore the EUPG group is a growing organisation with many new employees. So the Quality Management System is growing with the organisation and the new employees need support to ensure high quality conduct of the clinical studies in hand. A vision on Quality Assurance and the ambition to build quality into our organisation are important aspects to this role.

hits.title: Projectleider/Onderzoeker Insectenketen
hits.job_description:
Ben jij een deskundige op het gebied van de kweek van insecten voor "feed & food"? Wil je graag bijdragen aan ontwikkeling en innovatie in de Nederlandse en internationale insectenketen? Ben je nieuwsgierig naar de rol van insecten in het sluiten van kringlopen? Werk je graag samen in de ontwikkeling en uitvoering van onderzoek naar bijvoorbeeld de voeding van insecten en opschaling van de insectenkweek? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!

Ons voedselproductie en -consumptie systeem is complex en er zijn veel uitdagingen om dit systeem te verduurzamen. We worden geconfronteerd met klimaatverandering, uitputting van natuurlijke hulpbronnen, vervuiling van onze leefomgeving en afnemende biodiversiteit. Tegelijkertijd zien we trends zoals urbanisatie, een steeds kritischer houding ten aanzien van de wijze waarop we ons voedsel produceren en een toenemende vraag naar eiwitrijk voedsel door een groeiende welvaart en wereldbevolking. Dit roept de vraag op hoe we op een duurzame en eerlijke manier voldoende gezond en veilig voedsel kunnen produceren. Bij Wageningen University & Research (WUR) werken we dagelijks aan het beantwoorden van zulke vraagstukken. Wageningen Livestock Research is een van de onderzoeksinstituten binnen WUR, en kijkt in het bijzonder naar de rol van dieren in het voedselsysteem en onderzoekt vraagstukken op het gebied van duurzame en rendabele veehouderij, insectenkweek en aquacultuur.

De insectenketen is in opkomst en kan bijdragen om de voedselketen in balans te houden. Insecten zijn een natuurlijke en vitale schakel in het sluiten van kringlopen en bieden kansen voor de ontwikkeling van kringlooplandbouw: voedselproductie met minimale inzet van grondstoffen en hulpbronnen, waarbij reststromen beschikbaar komen die ingezet worden als grondstof voor een andere schakel in de keten. Reststromen en co-producten uit bijvoorbeeld de landbouw en voedingsindustrie kunnen ingezet worden als voedsel voor insecten. Die insecten zijn vervolgens inzetbaar als diervoeder of voor humane consumptie.

Wij zoeken
Een projectleider/onderzoeker insectenketen.
Je belangrijkste taak binnen deze functie is het (mede) opzetten en uitvoeren van projecten. Daarbij onderzoek je de rol van insecten in het voedselsysteem, en zoek je naar antwoorden op onderzoeksvragen op gebied van bijvoorbeeld de voeding van insecten, insectenkweek systemen, de opschaling van de insectenkweek en de duurzaamheid van de insectenkweek.

Je werk bestaat uit het volgende:
  • Je stelt onderzoeksvoorstellen op, zorgt voor het (laten) uitvoeren van metingen, het analyseren van data en het rapporteren van de uitkomsten.
  • Je voert overleg met onder meer bedrijfsleven, overheden, partners en maatschappelijke organisaties.
  • Je presenteert uitkomsten van het onderzoek.
  • Je ontwikkelt scenario's en bekijkt welke trade-offs er kunnen optreden.
In deze functie heb je een grote mate van verantwoordelijkheid en zelfstandigheid, maar werk je ook nauw samen met collega's en partners. Je wordt uitgedaagd om over de grenzen van je eigen vakgebied heen te kijken.

hits.title: Assistant / Associate Professor in Digital Communication Science (Tenure Track)
hits.job_description:
Are you highly motivated to understand communication in an increasingly digital society and advance the use of computational social sciences? Are you focused on addressing social challenges in dynamic and polarized media environments? Are you interested in communication with a focus on life science?

The Strategic Communication (COM) group is looking for a hardworking and ambitious assistant/associate professor in Communication science with a focus on or interest in life science. In this position, you are responsible for the coordination, organization, and implementation of new research activities on the application of innovative approaches of computational social sciences in communication research. We expect you to generate external financial support for an innovative research agenda. You are interested in (global) challenges in life science domains (e.g., health, climate change, and sustainable consumption). As our new colleague, you will critically explore and contribute to the understanding of how data-driven approaches in digital communication contexts can impact and contribute to broader individual and collective shifts in these life science domains. This includes, but is not limited to:
  • studying communication in online media, especially with regard to understanding digital communication mechanisms, processes of polarization and/or the presence and effects of mis- and disinformation;
  • computational data collections and analysis to study a digital media environment;
  • evaluating the reach, content, and impact of digital communication campaigns in life science contexts.
Furthermore, we challenge you to motivate and teach students and to be involved in the innovation of our education. A part of the teaching duties includes the development of two courses in the new master specialization 'Data science for health promotion', in cooperation with other chair groups. This interspecialization will be further developed into a full master's program at Wageningen University. You are expected to work with students from various programs, supervise them in the use of digital data approaches in communication, and support them in executing coherent research projects. We provide you with training and mentoring to accomplish all of this.

You prefer inter- or transdisciplinary approaches and an international orientation. To address current problems and solutions, societal engagement (e.g., with governments, societal actors, and researchers) is both a topic for analysis, as well as an approach to work with society in teaching and research projects.

As an assistant/associate professor you are able to navigate between and connect to the interdisciplinary fields of computational science as well as strategic communication. As such, you feel comfortable with a wide range of perspectives present in both communication science and computational science.
Tenure Track is a career path for hardworking scientists who pursue to excel in education and research. We seek to attract scientific talent and to stimulate and support their development.

hits.title: Science Analysis Pipeline Developer for Multi-Messenger Data Analysis Tools
hits.job_description:
We seek a creative developer to build an innovative science prototype pipeline to combine data from multiple astronomical/astroparticle observatories with advanced theoretical models, for the first time, into a fully integrated and statistically correct treatment.  

The project will be carried out within the context of the European project ESCAPE (European Science Cluster of Astronomy & Particle Physics ESFRI research infrastructures) that brings together the communities of astronomy, astroparticle and particle physics with the goal to develop open-science platforms and multi-messenger big data infrastructure that is open and FAIR, and to make software interoperable and open source. As part of this effort, another goal is to build a domain-specific European Open Science Cloud (EOSC).  

What are you going to do

This position is part of the European research project UE H2020 'EOSC Future', specifically to develop a prototype scientific analysis pipeline for the 'Extreme Universe' test science projects. Theoretical models of astrophysics sources produce predictions of radio through gamma-ray fluxes as well as neutrino fluxes, however there is currently no tool that can statistically assess goodness of fit to all data types simultaneously. The goal of the project is to develop a prototype pipeline for model comparison to photon and neutrino flux data simultaneously, accounting for the various instrument responses.

The selected candidate will work together with teams involved in EOSC Future and ESCAPE Future, primarily within the science data teams of the Cherenkov Telescope Array (CTA) next generation very-high-energy gamma-ray facility, and KM3NeT, the next generation ocean-based neutrino detector.

A completed a MSc in computer science, information technology, mathematics, physics or astronomy. 

Key competences sought: 

  • experienced in collaborative software development, Python programming and notebooks;
  • knowledge of standard software development practices such as version control, code review, continuous integration, and clear documentation.
  • knowledge of software engineering principles and tools for configuration management, bug reporting, etc.
  • good communication in English (written & oral) and interpersonal skills. 
  • ability to work both independently and within teams in an international environment. 

Additional competences a plus:

  • experience with the Scientific Python Stack (e.g. Numpy/SciPy/Pandas/Jupyter) and domain-specific tools like gammapy, astropy and/or 3ML.
  • experience with astroparticle, X-ray and/or high-energy physics data.
  • interest in professional-quality software design and data modelling.

The use of data science is crucial to improve the safety of our food and feed. Within WFSR we have created a new data science team combining a broad range of skills and knowhow to apply data science in the domain of food safety. As team manager of the data science team, you are responsible for (developing) the team and the team members and also for the research and projects carried out by the team.

hits.title: PhD student on: "Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) in Interstitial Lung Disease: the M-ILD study"
hits.job_description:
Interstitial Lung Disease (ILD) prevalence is high and progressively increasing. Every year 500 new ILD-patients are diagnosed at Erasmus MC. Overall median ILD survival is poor ranging from 5 to 14 years. A recent landmark study demonstrated a reduction in ILD disease progression using costly anti-fibrotic drugs. However, half ILD-patients do not benefit from these expensive anti-fibrotic drugs, but could be better treated with anti-inflammatory or combined treatment. Hence, there is an unmet need for a monitoring tool to phenotype ILD-patients by assessing the amount of pulmonary fibrosis and inflammation to guide treatment choices and monitor response.

Current monitoring, namely computed tomography and lung function tests cannot differentiate between fibrotic lung disease and active inflammation. Chest Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) can offer a one-stop-shop solution for ILD providing structural and functional information in a single examination, such as ventilation inflammation perfusion and structure (VIPS-MRI).

The aim of this clinical project is to develop an innovative MRI technology for effective phenotyping, patient-tailored treatment guiding and monitoring of therapy response in ILD-patients through the quantification of both fibrosis and inflammation. A novel imaging chest-MRI protocol will be developed and compared to positron emission tomography MRI (PET-MRI) to quantify inflammation and fibrosis. Dedicated post-processing tools for advanced imaging analysis of chest-MRI will be developed. The PhD student will design the new MRI protocol and execute studies on patients with ILD. The PhD will also develop the needed advanced post-processing tools to quantify fibrosis and inflammation on MR images.

hits.title: PhD Student – Senior Friendly Care Trajectories (1,0 fte)
hits.job_description:
We are recruiting a PhD candidate for a project on senior friendly care trajectories. You will will combine the scientific disciplines of Health Service Operations Management (HSOM) and Integrated Care to perform research on senior friendly care trajectories. With the aging of the population the number of patients with multi-morbidity is increasing. Older persons are living longer at home and frequently require a combination of cure, (home) care and social support. Episodes of hospital care, planned admissions or emergency situations, may entail changes in the care after discharge. Transfers between institutions and the home setting, as well as integration of care at home require planning and coordination to ensure continuity and quality of care for the patient. Delivering the right care on the right place at the right time ensures senior friendly and cost effective care with reablement as main aim. Reablement is “a person-centred, holistic approach that aims to enhance an individual's physical and/or other functioning, to increase or maintain their independence in meaningful activities of daily living at their place of residence and to reduce their need for long-term services”[1].  This may not only require optimizing the existing care organization, but also improving the care provision by developing innovative ways for care delivery and for transfers between institutional and home care.

Health Service Operations Management (HSOM) traditionally focusses on high production levels and efficiency, but shifted towards a more process-oriented approach with attention for the patient. However, until now, operations management research has mostly focused on institutional care, especially hospital care, and has paid less attention to care in the community and care in networks, while the number of days people stay in an institution is decreasing. This implies that applying OM approaches to primary care and to the home environment of patients create opportunities to enrich the knowledge base and transfer knowledge to new settings. An approach that focusses on the connection between primary and secondary care, and the alignment of care at home, whilst taking the network of the patient into consideration, is Integrated Care. Integrated Care research both focusses on patient populations, such as older persons, as on a specific disease, e.g. Diabetes or COPD. The expectation is that combining concepts and approaches of operations management and Integrated care will lead to possibilities to improve care for older persons living at home or nursing homes and add to delivering the right care on the right place at the right timeand reablement.

The research will be conducted in the province of Zeeland in close collaboration with healthcare organizations and professionals in that region. The PhD is expected to translate real life problems in the care trajectories in Zeeland into research that will benefit reablement and the optimization of care for older persons. As such the PhD will be member of the Academic Collaborative Centre Older Persons Care Zeeland (AWOZ), a collaborative network of health and research institutions. Information on AWOZ can be found on the following website: https://www.awoz.nl/

Finally, you will teach in the education programs of Erasmus School of Health Policy & Management (about 15% of your time).

[1] Metzelthin, S., Rostgaard, T., Parsons, M., & Burton, E. (2020). Development of an internationally accepted definition of reablement: A Delphi study. <i>Ageing and Society,</i> 1-16. doi:10.1017/S0144686X20000999

Campus Fryslân invites applications for a motivated colleague at the level of assistant professor of Science and Technology studies. Within Campus Fryslân, you will have a key role in teaching and coordinating a minor programme Data Wise: Data Science in Society. Your expertise in science and technology studies with a focus on data and infrastructures will make you an equally important contributor to teaching in the new bachelor programme Data Science and Society (DSS, to be offered for the first time in 2022-23). Two STS courses are part of the first year curriculum of the DSS bachelor and you will have the opportunity to help shape this exciting new programme. You will specifically develop and teach twocourses in the first year of the DSS programme (STS and Data 1: Data Creation and Circulation and STS, and STS and Data 2: Data use, Value and Responsibility.)
As coordinator of Data Wise, you will function as the figurehead of the programme, both internally and externally, ensure the coherence of the programme, introduce updates and improvements to the programme based on emerging trends in the field, and work with teaching staff in different faculties and with the steering group of Data Wise.

You will also coordinate and teach part of the course Introduction to Data, which is offered in the first 6 weeks of the minor and creates common ground for students coming from different faculties. Several lecturers from various fields contribute to Introduction to Data. You are furthermore expected to conduct a number of additional teaching related tasks such as project supervision. The position is particularly suited for someone with clear interest in interdisciplinary approaches to data, with a desire to shape the future of data expertise and possessing infrastructural imagination.

In subsequent years, there may be opportunities for teaching in the bachelor programme Global Responsibility and Leadership, especially in the Knowledge Systems for Sustainability track. Both GRL and Data Wise are highly regarded programmes, as evidenced by high rankings in student surveys (GRL) and very high demand for places in the minor (DW). These teaching programmes are innovative, stimulate teaching innovation and excellence and involve collaboration with stakeholders. They have a strong emphasis on digital skills, responsible use of data, and leadership development.

Research
With regard to research, you will be part of the Knowledge Infrastructures Department at Campus Fryslân, and join an interdisciplinary team whose core concern to develop knowledge infrastructures that can contribute to sustainability and liveable futures. The KI department participates in a range of international research projects and actively contribute to the development of novel research practices around data in the areas of ecology, climate change and sustainable energy among others. Membership of the Data Research Centre is also an option, as is joining the Jantina Tammes School for Digital Society, Technology and AI. Opportunities for supervision of bachelor theses and co-supervision of PhD projects are also available, depending on affinity and team composition.

Je pakt een breed scala aan ondersteunende werkzaamheden samen met je collega-secretaresses op. Dagelijks komen verschillende typen medewerkers en studenten met allerlei soorten vragen bij jou en je collega’s. hits.title: Assistant Professor Clinical Psychology (0.8 - 1.0 FTE)
hits.job_description:
The Department of Psychology has a job opening for the position of Assistant Professor. The position is embedded within the Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences and contains a combination of teaching (60%) and research (40%).

As an Assistant Professor you will be employed in the Clinical Psychology division of the Department of Psychology. You will be participating in teaching the Bachelor’s programme in Psychology in the domains relevant to Clinical Psychology and the international Master’s programme in Clinical Psychology. Teaching involves (large-scale) lectures, (small-scale) instruction and individual supervision of clinical internships and research theses, along with more general coordination and administration activities.

The research within Clinical Psychology covers three broad research programmes. The first encompasses (mostly applied) research on underlying mechanisms and treatment of consequences of loss and psychotrauma in children, adults, and families. The second includes (mostly) laboratory and clinical research on causes, underlying mechanisms and novel ways to optimize treatment of trauma  and anxiety related disorders. The third programme focuses on depression, suicidality and personality disorders and employs RCTs and clinical experiments to investigate the effectiveness of psychotherapy, predictors of response and mechanisms of change, with the ultimate goal to advance precision mental health. The Assistant Professor will join this last research programme.


Core tasks include:

  • participating in teaching at Bachelor’s and Master’s level. Teaching involves individual supervision as well as lectures and workgroups in clinically oriented courses;
  • coordination of parts of the curriculum;
  • participating in one or more of the division's research programmes;
  • publishing research findings in (high impact) international scientific journals;
  • contributing to the acquisition of external research funding for the benefit of the research programme. 

For our education and research programmes, clinical registration and work experience in mental health care is desirable. Experience with experimental research is also an advantage.

We believe individual and collective achievements should be in balance. That is why we assess both individual and team performance. We stimulate good academic leadership at all levels. Last but not least, we encourage researchers to share the results of scientific research with society, so that collectively we can achieve more and increase the university’s contribution to society.

hits.title: Assistant Professor in Medieval History of Asia and/or Africa
hits.job_description:
We seek an Assistant Professor in Medieval History of Asia and/or Africa to provide education in a dynamic context with ample opportunities for the development of innovative teaching methods. Your research will be part of the Amsterdam School of Historical Studies (ASH), one of the five research schools of the Amsterdam Institute for Humanities Research. ASH represents and fosters the study of the human past from Antiquity to the present day. It brings together more than 200 academics from Amsterdam’s Faculty of Humanities, who participate in ca. 25 research groups. Depending on your expertise, you will join one of the research groups/centres within ASH, for example those on environmental history or urban history. You will also help foster a dialogue between colleagues working on medieval histories and cultures of Europe.

The position will be embedded within the department of History, European Studies & Religious Studies in the capacity group History. Historians at the UvA explore history in all its breadth and complexity.

What are you going to do?

Tasks and responsibilities:

  • designing and conducting independent research in the field of Medieval History of Asia and/or Africa, with a strong preference for transregional approaches, including the history of slavery, migration, and/or environmental history, resulting in academic publications in peer-reviewed international journals and/or books;
  • actively pursuing external funding for research, notably funding from research councils, national as well as European;
  • actively contributing to and developing national and international research networks and other forms of cooperation;
  • actively contributing to the research activities of the Amsterdam School of Historical Studies and the National Research School for Medieval studies;
  • developing, coordinating and teaching courses, in Dutch and English, in the Bachelor and (Research) Master programmes in History;
  • supervising Bachelor and Master theses and tutoring students; co-supervising PhD theses;
  • actively contributing to the development and improvement of the broader teaching programmes in the Department;
  • taking part in committees and working groups, and carrying out departmental administrative tasks.
hits.requirements_description:
Requirements

What do you have to offer?

You are a dynamic, ambitious and innovative researcher with a strong profile, demonstrable by international publications and an international academic network. Your publications show a broad knowledge of Asian and/or African history in the period between 600-1500, with a familiarity with broad transregional and interdisciplinary approaches. Your research contributes to the profile of the Amsterdam School of Historical Studies.

You are able to develop and provide disciplinary and interdisciplinary modules on Medieval History, preferably with a focus on either the history of slavery, migration, and/or environmental history.

You will also contribute to the general curriculum of the Bachelor and (Research) Master programmes in History. You have a proven track record of teaching topics beyond your own research focus, a willingness to work in interdisciplinary teams and the ability to offer inspiring lectures and tutorials that attract a wide range of students.

Your experience and profile:

  • a PhD in Medieval History. Affinity for interdisciplinary and transregional perspectives is considered a plus;
  • an international academic network in the research area concerned;
  • active and ambitious researcher with a strong publication record, commensurate with the level of the position;
  • demonstrable ability and ambition to obtain external research grants;
  • broad and relevant teaching experience, preferably at both the BA and MA level;
  • excellent command of Dutch and English. If Dutch is not the mother tongue, an active and passive command must be acquired within two years of the employment contract and the state examination for Dutch as a Second Language programme II must be passed;
  • experience with digital and audiovisual teaching facilities and affinity with IT in university teaching;
  • willing to take an active part in the administrative and collegial life in the Department;

hits.job_description:
The project

The COVID-19 pandemic demonstrates how underprepared the world has been for emerging pandemic respiratory viruses, such as SARS-CoV-2. Although vaccines have been developed, SARS-CoV-2 is still actively spreading and new variants are constantly emerging. The impact of new mutations in the viral proteins responsible for viral replication and transcription is still poorly understood. We recently developed a SARS-CoV-2 mini-genome assay to identify new inhibitors of SARS-CoV-2 replication and test the effect of mutations in the viral replication proteins on viral RNA synthesis and the sensitivity of SARS-CoV-2 to current antivirals, such as remdesivir or favipiravir.

About your role

We are looking for an enthusiastic postdoc to work a joint project between the Laboratory of Applied Evolutionary Biology of the Amsterdam University Medical Center (location AMC), the National Institute for Public Health and the Environment (RIVM), and the Department of Molecular Biology of Princeton University. The appointed postdoc will work on a ZonMW/NWO funded project to study SARS-CoV-2 replication and the impact of mutations in variants of concern (VoC) on SARS-CoV-2 sensitivity to antivirals and replication kinetics.

The postdoc will be primarily responsible for the continued development of the SARS-CoV-2 replication activity assay, the screening of inhibitor libraries, and the testing of emerging SARS-CoV-2 mutations using in vitro and virus assays. There will be ample opportunities to develop other skills and contribute to multiple aspects of the project.

hits.title: PhD Scholarship Innovative Business Models in Agriculture (1.0 FTE)
hits.job_description:
Scholarship opportunity
Campus Fryslân invites applications for a four-year PhD scholarship candidate to complete a dissertation on the topic of innovative business models in agriculture. Within Campus Fryslân, you will be joining the Sustainable Entrepreneurship in a Circular Economy department in which senior scholars and PhD researchers develop a wide variety of research lines and projects including leadership, business models, innovation, and societal impact (http://www.rug.nl/cf/cse).

Agriculture is important for the Northern region of the Netherlands. However, the financial forecasts of farmers is challenging and the social appreciation of current business models has declined. The efficiency farming business models is at the end stage of its life cycle among others because of the large-scale negative ecological effects. As a result, niche farmers in the region innovate and develop new business models based on the opportunities and limitations of nature. These new business models have systemic implications for value chain partners, government policies and consumer behaviour. The new business models directly contribute to the triple bottom-line performance of farmers and their context.

The PhD research enables farmers to identify farm-specific quick wins and systemic new ecological and social added value (including water quality, nitrogen and biodiversity). The farmers will learn how to capture these new added value propositions derived from their stand-alone firms or in collaboration with regional co-stakeholders and colleague farmers. The PhD research will analyse the success factors of the design, implementation, management and regional dissemination of new farming business models.
Broad topics of interest of the doctoral research include (but are not limited to):

• What are the barriers and the success factors of innovative business models?
• What is the added value of innovative business models for farmers and the region?
• How can new value chains for innovative business models successfully be developed and implemented?
• How can regions develop ecosystems for innovative business models?

You will benefit from the large business networks with regional and national innovative farmers and existing programs on new business models (https://uvhn.maglr.com/inspiratieboek/universiteit-van-het-noorden). You will be enrolled in the Graduate School of Campus Fryslân. You will be co-supervised by Prof. Gjalt de Jong (promotor) and Dr Niels Faber (co-promotor).

The PhD candidate will be enrolled in the Graduate School Campus Fryslân (GSCF). If interested, the PhD candidate could also have a role to play in the Master program Sustainable Entrepreneurship.

hits.title: Postdoc position on 'Data-model integration of (past) East Asian Monsoon climate dynamics’ (2 years, 1.0 FTE)
hits.job_description:
The Department of Earth Sciences currently seeks a highly-motivated and skilled applicant for a postdoctoral position to work on integrating multi-proxy records of past East Asian Monsoon climate with Earth system model outputs. This is a work package of the VIDI project 'Elucidating monsoon dynamics: deconvolving temperature and precipitation signals in East Asian Monsoon climate reconstructions’, awarded to Dr Francien Peterse, funded by the Netherlands Organization for Scientific Research (NWO).
The East Asian Monsoon (EAM) is one of the strongest monsoon systems on Earth, and will likely be affected by ongoing global warming. However, data-model comparison is complicated due to the mixed signals in paleoreconstructions. The current position aims to synthesize individual proxy records of temperature and precipitation for the EAM domain and to compare them with climate model simulations. These proxy records are being generated within the same project based on lipid biomarkers, their isotopic composition, and clumped isotope measurements on land snails from several sections of the Chinese Loess Plateau (CLP). The availability of precipitation isotope reconstructions will furthermore allow comparison with isotope enabled climate model outputs. The research will be performed at Utrecht University in The Netherlands.

hits.title: Post-doc on data-guided circular strategies for circular ICT in businesses
hits.job_description:
The department of Sustainable Design Engineering (SDE) is looking for a post-doctoral researcher (2 years) to do research on tools for data-driven adoption of circular ICT solutions in businesses.

Design for Sustainability (DfS) is a research group with design for the circular economy as one of its core focal areas. Research aims at the development of methods and tools that enable the design of products that have multiple lifecycles. This research area explores circular design strategies, such as product life-extension, reuse, remanufacturing and recycling, and the technologies and business models that enable these strategies. Knowledge and Intelligence Design (KInD) is a human-centered and multi-disciplinary  research group focusing on the relationship between the science and practice of design, and the digital technology that fuels intelligent products, services, and systems.

We are currently searching for a post-doctoral researcher. The post doc will operate in a national consortium with 10 partners that has the objective to develop a new Critical Resource Planning for ICT tool that will help businesses in their purchase, maintenance, and repair decisions to adopt more circular ICT solutions and to change their behaviors into more sustainable behaviors. The consortium will develop a prototype for this tool: RePlanIT. 

In this project, the post doc will be responsible to develop and validate a prototype of a scalable and dynamic circular product passport and a circular resource planner for ICT hardware, using laptops and data servers as the case. The passport should store information for ICT decision-makers, both about the delivered product (static) and about performance during the use phase (dynamic), which is important for maintenance, reuse, refurbishment, and replacement of the product in relation to the required functionalities of and compatibility within the entire IT system in which the hardware runs. The resource planner aims to make the data from the product passport transparent for ICT service providers (suppliers and/or internal service providers) and refurbishers. This system should enable to report and manage on circular KPIs by (a) predicting the necessity and timing of maintenance (condition-based maintenance), refurbishment and upgrading of the ICT hardware at product level; (b) determine the remaining service life of specific components in case of refurbishment, and (c) develop (phased) circular design and replacement strategies at system level.

The post doc will be part of the Circular Design lab within the faculty. This virtual lab brings together students and researchers with an interest in circular economy. Further, the post doc  will be part of AMS Research Fellow community, specifically the Circularity in Urban Regions program.

We are looking for a candidate with a PhD in design, sustainability/industrial ecology, or computer science/data management, who has a strong interest in studying the intersections between sustainability/circular economy, design tools and circular decision-making. In addition to the research, the post doc will be actively involved in teaching at the Industrial Design Engineering faculty (teaching load of 20%).
